Reviews.Title: “THE STANDARD BY WHICH ALL HOTELS SHOULD BE JUDGED”
Reviews.Author: LondonJammer
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at some superb hotels around the world,i can without too much difficulty say that this hotel as a city hotel must surely be the best in the world... We were upgraded to an upper house corner suite and WOW what a room. Everything was perfection in its detailing and quality,design and function. From the ipod touch to order room service,listen to music,check out what to do,to the free maxi bar,from the 3 tvs to the most comfy beds ever,from the most amazing views of hong kong to the REN toiletries,everything was 1st class.. Breakfast was the best i have ever had and evening dinner in the michelin starred restaurant with it"s superb food,service,wines and views was perfection. The staff were simply spot on,no false smiles but genuine hospitality and warmth. I would without hesitation return to this hotel and urge anyone who enjoys a true first class experience to book this hotel as you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneBookgirl
Reviews.Content: I have been fortunate to stay at many world reknown five star hotels, including The Peninsula , and my expectations of The Upper House were very high after reading Trip Advisor reviews. Despite this, The Upper House has exceeded anything that I have previously experienced, or could have imagined, of a hotel. The hotel itself is very beautiful, with tranquil spaces and elegant decor. The rooms are remarkably large for Hong Kong, and the full wall windows allow stunning views. Each room is actually effectively four rooms, with a large living room/bedroom + dressing room + bathroom (with enormous bath, more view, TV and amazing shower) + toilet. With the heavenly Ren toilettries, although I'm in HK for a conference, I feel as though I have had a week in a spa. The location is very central, and the hotel is on top of Pacific Place shopping centre and Admiralty, so travel anywhere via MTR (the super efficient, clean, safe, easy to use train system) is so easy. It's 10 minutes in a taxi to the HK Medical Conference Centre (and about AUD$8), for any doctors considering where to stay for a conference. It's the Staff which really make the hotel so special, though. The Staff go beyond being willing to do things to improve your stay to actively seraching for ways to do this. There are many examples in the reviews, but I've had two experiences in particular. I was expecting a parcel to be delivered from a shop, and it did not arrive. I rang the concierge to ask whether anything had been delivered, and they asked the name and location of the shop. They then rang the shop, ascertained when the package could be delivered, arranged for this, and rang back to confirm with me. I over-shopped, and asked the staff about posting items home. They arranged for three different sized boxes to be left in my room, then arranged for the boxes to be weighed, and costed different ways to send the items home. Super impressive. If you're considering where to stay in Hong Kong, stay here. It's perfect for leisure trips, and have made my business trip an absolute pleasure. You'll be so glad that you did. I may well have to be dragged out.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool hotel. Excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Tina E
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, it has intimate spaces,sensory ambience, very welcoming. Nice amenities. Fab design and best of all really amazing service. Wonderful bar on rooftop. Excellent restaurant too. Guest rooms are huge for hong kong. Almost 600 sqft.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful experience at the Upper House”
Reviews.Author: UpperGuest
Reviews.Content: The Upper House never fail with the little moment of touch they offered to their VIP guest. I did a short transist in HK from my trip in San Francisco and I stayed at Upper House once again. As usual they maintained the high standard of hospitality and service. Greatly appreciate the staff and the management team and a very good thank you for all the artangement to make my short transist in HK a memorable one! Dr E Chow Upper Guest - trip advisor

Reviews.Title: “My home in HK”
Reviews.Author: Jacknoy
Reviews.Content: Me, my husband and my daughter had a blast at our recent stay (aug 25-27) in Hong Kong; thanks to The Upper House. From baby powder to chocolate milk and warm welcome, the staff are truly the best! I never experienced hospitality like what these guys had given. For the room where we stayed at, it was simply perfect! The bathroom set up was superb! And of course the view was to die for!!! I visit HK every two months so ill make sure to see them again soon...

Reviews.Title: “Best of Everything”
Reviews.Author: Anton P
Reviews.Content: From the time you book your trip to the last day, this place takes care of you. Apart from the awesome customer service, UH has the best bathroom amenities, the best bed and pillows so far, an ultra spacious bathroom that you'd want to sleep in, a ridiculous amount of free beverages and snacks to your stomach's content, amazing views from wherever your room is, the food was delicious. The ambiance of the room is so relaxing, everything complements each other, from the color scheme, down to the furniture and carpet in the bedroom. My only gripe is that I wish I had more room to stomach in the great food! In a nutshell, experience the Upper House and you'll never want to stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Cecilia C
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved the Upper House in HK:) I never experienced similar service and attention to detail as the one provided by the very discrete and efficient staff. It feels like being looked after at home! Rooms are extremely spacious with breathtaking views, beds are super comfortable and great wardrobe/bathroom area. All drinks and food in the room are complimentary and make for great snacks, including the afternoon tea they provide. The restaurant upstairs has amazing views and food. Plus amazing location and very discrete entrance! Will definitely go back:)

Reviews.Title: “Our home in HK”
Reviews.Author: YWK704
Reviews.Content: Since 2010, whenever we visit Hong Kong, we have been staying at the upper house. We are always satisfied with TUH's guest oriented service, especially the bathroom amenities and watermelon juice (^-^)/. TUH shall be our home in Hong Kong also in future as well.

Reviews.Title: “The best boutique hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: AM3108
Reviews.Content: This is not the first time for me in the hotel and once again it was a superb expiriance. I am a heavy traveler and the service here is superb like in no other place. Kristina from the guest services as well as the hotel manager provided a great service. The restaurant at the 49th floor has a great location, however the food is just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Expereince like no other”
Reviews.Author: MichaelNYCKIM
Reviews.Content: Since work puts me on the road all year long, I have the chance to stay at some of the best rated hotels across the globe. I even stayed at the most talked about hotels in Hong Kong before trying the Upper House. The Upper House exceeded my other experiences by far. It's more than a modern designed hotel or a comfortable place to stay. It has all that but it also has a rare quality to it that you cannot just buy. The team who works there truely know what hospitality is. They disarm you and make you feel like you are old friends. The way they engage me from the moment I walked into the doors for check in, to passing each staff thru out the day, to the moment I checked out has been memorable experience for me. They truly care about making this stay a special moment for their guests. This is something that takes time to instill into the staff thru great management, intense education and good hiring. A talent that other service industries groups can learn from… I know I will be using them as a model. I feel the bar has been set, and feel bad for the other hotels who are following them on my journey thru the world. I cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: Astilbe_Arendsii
Reviews.Content: In HK for weekend, arrived Friday very late (delayed flight from Beijing), felt frazzled but once we arrived at this sleek, elegant establishment we were - well, transported. Being upgraded to a suite was a delight. Friendly welcome from the staff. Showed us around our room, then up to 49th for midnight martinis and a cheese plate. Incredible attention to detail. Nice toilettries, several newspapers to read, minibar (not mini) had many nice wines to select from. Espresso machine. Dazzling views of Victoria Harbour. And the "experience managers" are terrificly helpful. This will be our new 'home' whenever we're back here.

Reviews.Title: “Just one word: Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: TravelGeeks2009
Reviews.Content: So that does tell it all, doesn’t it? I once called the Four Seasons in Hong Kong here in Tripadvisor the “Harvard” under the hotel management, but this one is the Stanford. In terms of quality, it’s a bit the Olympic gold race between China and the US, not sure who wins the most gold medals . I arrived at HK airport and was forgotten to arrange for a pickup by the hotel. I called my contact person at the hotel and with the blink of an eye I was tapped on the shoulder by the hotel driver, ready to bring me to Upper House in a fashionable Lexus SUV (doesn’t that tell you all? Something different from the Rolls Royce that The Peninsula Hotel sends to pick you up). In terms of comfort and services, this hotel is among a select group of contemporary, trendy hotels in the world where elegance, guest service space and luxury is the predominant mindset of the hotel staff. All you can possibly think of is here, well almost, that is. Two exceptions that would make it even more attractive, no Spa and no swimming pool, but actually that is not too big a deal as the hotel is gladly providing a day pass for swimming pool at the nearby Shangri-La hotel. For an eclectic traveler this is a very good alternative to the Four Seasons (more for business) or the Ritz Carlton (Kowloon). More accurately I think I prefer this hotel over the FS and RC in Hong Kong. Located in Pacific Place, close to Hong Kong Island Central, yet more quiet and conveniently close to the Pacific shopping mall and nearby JW Marriott and some restaurants and cafes. The hotel reception starts at the 49th floor (where does that remind me of? Park Hyatt in Tokyo - remember “Lost in Translation”?) while you being greeted on the ground floor by a very welcoming staff at the lower level at the hotel entry. You will be escorted to your room where you will find a whole array of modern amenities, among which a Illy espresso machine and tea boiler, the fridge is filled with cooled drinks, beer is free, as is water and soda drinks, wines and other selection of drinks are available against a price lower than what you normally being charged at major hotels. Even milk is available free for those (like me) who love it. And if you like sweets, chocolate M&Ms, Milano cookies, nuts are free and will be refilled every day. The small service unit provides cutlery, nice China cups, a teapot and even a toaster. The bathroom is very spacious with bath and (rain)shower, a nice subtly lighted wooden art piece and comfortably big towels. One slight criticism here, the mirror lights in the bathroom aren’t particularly attractive (they might you look bleak, athough there is a switch to lower the color). The beds are, unlike what incidentally was mentioned by another guest in Tripadvisor, very comfortable, soft, yes they are, with soft feather pillows (want a different pillow, I am sure Guest services will provide it). I stayed in a “Studio 80” on the 48th floor on the “hill” side as the harbor view is not was it used to be anyhow (mostly cloudy and grey at this time of the year). A dressing-walk-in room with nice bathrobes (I have been told they are a favorite in the hotel’s shop), a large Samsung LCD TV screen, wifi - included in the price – and speakers with sufficient equipment to hook up your iPod, iPad or other mp3 device for your music to be played both in the room as well as in the bathroom. The beds are Four Seasons quality ,as are the pillows. The ultimate service was when housekeeping came to change the inner part of the curtain rails into ones that do not let in any light in the room (I am sensitive to light coming in the sleeping room). Superb! The hotel has a very nice restaurant (I heard Swire, the group owning this hotel) hired a New York chef) and lounge at the same level as the reception, 49th floor, a popular place for having late afternoon drinks and a subsequent lovely dinner, overlooking colorful high rise buildings, glowing in the evening light (like you only have in HK, if you are lucky with the smog and weather). Two small things that are not available which would make this hotel the absolute contender for best hotel in HK, are the lack of a swimming pool and of a Spa, but as said that is being arranged for in the nearby Shangri-La hotel. If you want the Lexus hotel car is available for rent (be it against a pricey ticket, more than 70 euros for the hour). The staff goes out of its way to make your stay wonderful and does things many hotels do not offer (which hotel sends a bell boy to accompany you to find the nearest bank?). Overall this is the sort of hotel that has set a whole new standard in the hotel business. I really enjoyed it, so hopefully you do, too.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury made easy”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan C
Reviews.Content: So many hotels go overboard in their attempt to deliver great service. The Upper House just make it look easy and natural. The rooms are great, the location is great, but its the experience that differentiates. No fussing, no waiting - just consistently great service from every department and a few added unexpected touches that made staying there with two small children relaxing, fun and easy.

Reviews.Title: “W O W!”
Reviews.Author: petitebrioche
Reviews.Content: Who knew? Atop the JW Marriot in Pacifc Place is an absolute gem. Upper House. Home! So many reviews here all say the same thing - fabulous! Don't stay at the W! Don't stay at the Four Seasons! Forget the Mandarin Oriental. You have to try this! service - outstanding bathrooms - unbelievable comfort - superb guest experience - paramount I can tell you about the surprises - but I think you should experience them for yourself! Work trip - reward yourself Holiday - reward yourself Staycation - reward yourself Upper house - there is nothing like it- seriously!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, couldn't fault a thing”
Reviews.Author: Danrichoz
Reviews.Content: Usually we stay at the Mandarin Oriental when visiting HK; for the price of the MO's entry level room (35sqm) I just wanted to see what else I could get for our money in HK. Wow, I am so glad I did, for a little bit less than what we would have paid at the MO (room only), we got the Summer Retreat package for an Island facing Studio 80 room (though were upgraded to a Harbour view on arrival). The package included an airport pick up, breakfast, WiFi and free reign on the Maxi bar (excluding wine); none of this was included in the MO price. The room was huge for HK (80sqm) and the view was great, even from the freestanding bath that is positioned in the floor to ceiling windows. The attention to detail was superb; from the fantastic Ren products in the bathroom, to the jars of M&Ms, Cookies and Mentos in the Maxi bar; from the huge King size bed to the luxurious bathroom, from the quality of the room finishes to the amenities in the draw of the desk draw. And what really set this place apart was the level of service, it was superbly attentive but without being over bearing. Before we arrived I received an email asking if we had any special requirements for the room; our request was nothing major, just some soy milk and some extra apple chargers - to be honest I didn't think any more of it, but on arrival low and behold, the soy milk was in the fridge and the extra apple chargers had been placed on the desk; now that doesn't happen every day..... Breakfast is served a la carte in Cafe Gray Deluxe, at the top of the tower, awesome views across the harbour, great food and superb service. We loved it so much we ate there for dinner, again really good.... Really can't say enough about how great this place is - just simply loved it and we will be back as soon as the opportunity arises!!

Reviews.Title: “Home from home”
Reviews.Author: ebel
Reviews.Content: Loved it! The whole team were really friendly and helpful. The room was fantastic...it is decorated just as we are planning to do our flat, so we got lots of good tips! After a couple of weeks on the Mainland we were pretty Chinaed out so we spent a lot of time in the room chilling out and enjoying the view...including the typhoon that passed through. The breakfasts at Café de Luxe were excellent, lots of choice, you can be as health - or not - as you want.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome - Believe Everything youRead”
Reviews.Author: Watwood
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in late Mar/early Apr 12. Believe everything you read The Upper House is phenominal. Rooms excellent, staff and service outstanding and views from the top floor bar amzing. Nothing was too much trouble for The Upper House team and everyone genuinley wanted to help you have a good time. Woud we go back - oh yes, definately, probably for us now the only place to stay in Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Is there a better hotel anywhere?”
Reviews.Author: TheGlobalFinn
Reviews.Content: Fantastic rooms, unbelievable service, magnificent bathrooms, attention to every detail. I have stayed a few times and will stay every time that I am in town. Simply totally fantastic and like no other place in town. I have not had a better experience at any hotel anywhere in the world. I cannot imagine that anyone would rate Upper House as anything other than five stars. The whole experience is personal, the check in process is all on iPads, there is no desk to check in at. It all feels like coming home. Simply a great pleasure to stay here, every time.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant oasis of calm in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: lyonsong
Reviews.Content: I recently stay at the upper house for a 3 day holiday. The rooms were beautiful. We stayed at the same hotel 2 years ago and I am happy to report that the standards are still very high and well maintained. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly. The rooms are beautifully designed & decorated and the finishing touches are the icing on the cake. I can not speak more highly of this hotel, as a frequent traveller, this is one establishment that lives up to its description and then some. Some of the rooms have amazing views over the harbour whilst others look out towards the verdent green mountains behind. All rooms have that "in the middle of a bustling city feel" with out any of the stress or noise. we bookes a studin 70 room with a harbour view the first time we stayed and the view was jaw droppingly beautiful. Since then a new multi story building has been built in front, blocking some of that view. This time we were upgraged to a studio 80 room with harbour glimpses and mountain views. The studio 80 room does feel and is bigger, but honestly you wouldn't notice unless you were actually comparing, as I thought the studio 70 room from 2 years earlier was also very spacious. That said, I loved the extra space of the studio 80 room! In terms of the finish or decor in both rooms is identical so your not missing out on anything. The restaurant and bar on the 49th floor have great food and amazing views. They are not the cheapest rooms in HK but I think they are well worth it! You are right above Pacific Place shopping centre so you have all that shopping and eating on your door step. There is a great chinese restaurant on the lower ground floor that has great food too! Can't remember the name of it. There is no pool or spa service that I was aware of, not that I went looking!

Reviews.Title: “Spoiled for life after staying here...”
Reviews.Author: NextStopHongKong
Reviews.Content: City hotels where staying in your room beats going out are few and far in between -- and the UH still beats them all. An incredible level of service is what makes this hotel, from the young guys who open car doors for you, to the hotel manager who makes time for a cup of coffee if you want to chat. "Rooms" are more apartment-style, with huge bathrooms and an impeccable level of intelligent detail pervades every square foot -- the pillow in the bathtub, enormous bath rugs and a bottle of mineral water placed next to the coffee machine. When you add that to the view, location, and vanilla yoghurt in the restaurant, you wonder why this property is only #2 in HK. We stayed here for our first wedding anniversary weekend and if we could, we'd move in 'til our 25th. After staying at Four Seasons and Park Hyatts this was a welcome change from a strict copycat approach to hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome.”
Reviews.Author: damiendonnelly
Reviews.Content: Everything about this place is cool. Quirky sense of humour if you bother to read the legalese when you connect to wifi sums up the beauty of the design of the customer experience here. And the complimentary minibar rocks!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels”
Reviews.Author: JensBerlin_Germany
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent parts of our honeymoon in Hong Kong and stayed at The Upper House in May 2011. We both are hospitality professionals and not easy to impress, but The Upper House impressed both of us. The airport pick up with complimentary internet in the car - perfect, check-in - flawless, the room - the best I have ever seen, including a free Maxibar, great amenities, awesome view etc, concierge desk - very helpful and friendly, the restaurant - great food, friendly and efficient service and nice view, the workout area - small, but very nice and with the latest equipment. During our 5 nights we got an amenity almost every day: welcome amenity was a personalized wedding cake, third night a set of aroma candles, fourth night was a travel note book and at the last night a polo shirt of very high quality. The only minor thing to complain was the missing power outlet next to the bed to charge cellphones etc. But what is this compared with all the great service and amenities. Making a long story short, I would never stay anywhere else when returning to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable in every way”
Reviews.Author: Katrina70
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Upper House on the basis of all the TripAdvisor reviews and my experience surpassed everything I could have imagined. It is hard to set the bar high and then actually fulfill a guest's expectations, but The Upper House didn't falter at all. Like having a magic genie, everything we mentioned was miraculously realised. We chatted about our itinerary - and immediately tickets and reservations were booked. I remarked how much I liked the REN toiletries - before I knew it I was in possession of bottles and bottles of these lovely products. We upgraded to a suite on arrival and on our first night enjoyed the most spectacular view of the fireworks celebrating handover. The rooms are immaculate - restful and calming - beautiful to come back to after a busy day in the bustle of the city. I have stayed at the Four Seasons Hong Kong before, and I adore the Four Seasons generally, but The Upper House intimacy made for a better, more personal guest relations experience.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best if not 'THE BEST'”
Reviews.Author: artist0nh0liday
Reviews.Content: I am not one to write many reviews but the experience at the Upper House is one to be shared so that others can also enjoy. The service at the Upper House was impeccable and most attentive to our needs, so much so that on checking out; as the streets were blocked and no taxis were available, staff helped to take us the short walking distance to the MTR. The rooms are understated luxury with wonderful views of Hong Kong; the bathroom is amazing ... ... ... imagine a deep bath, with natural light flooding in from the large windows, remote control at your finger tips for the TV situated (secretly) behind the mirror panel. Our time at the Upper House was as if we were at 'home' with complimentary minibar and wifi - expresso coffee maker and the most wonderful selection of teas are provided for when you need that extra lift. There is so much more to this hotel that I would run out of superlatives - you open up a drawer and are delighted to find crockery and cutlery, another drawer a toaster was found. Yet another drawer in the desk produced a small scissor, correcting fluid, 'post it' and a eraser. As well as the comfortable luxurious bedding the hotel management have thought of all that their guests might require; it is a philosophy that other hotels would do well to also take on. Breakfast was most enjoyable at Cafe Gray, compliments to the chef and the staff for the food and service. I would also recommend the Cafe Gray Bar - take time to relax, spend time with friends and take in the incredible night views across Hong Kong. As I have said before I cannot write / describe in some many words the experience of our stay at the Upper House only to say that it is truly one of the best if not THE BEST hotels that we have had the pleasure of staying i

Reviews.Title: “the PERFECT hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: ns1399
Reviews.Content: Overall my stay at the UH has been great. The service was impeccable, attentive and pro-active. It often went beyond what you usually expect from high-end hotel services. The rooms are beautiful, large, dense with light and accessorized. I think it's called house for a reason...it does feel like home; when you are cruising around HK, you definitely want a place like this to rest and relax. However, at the same time you have the bar upstairs which is excellent and fun. So you really have the best of both worlds. Can't reccomend it enough. Just go and see for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!!!”
Reviews.Author: BKPU
Reviews.Content: Nothing more to say than almost perfection. Pure luxury. Incredible bathrooms. Boutique-feel. Good location. Breakfast was amazing. Airport transfer was seamless. Wish there was a larger gym and pool. Only negative was that it was noisy in the room right below the restaurant... to be expected I guess. Marcel was a great manager.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat”
Reviews.Author: Elysia
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in most of the five star hotels in Hong Kong and would rate the Upper House as one of the best. This was a very pleasant surprise after our extremely disappointing stay at the Ritz-Carlton Hong Kong just a few weeks before (see review). The Upper House is in a great location at Pacific Place - the best place to be on the island other than Central. It's a short MTR ride from the Airport Express Hong Kong station - or a short taxi ride if you have bags. The hotel was previously the Marriott residences before a major refurbishment by the Swire Group a couple of years ago. It's also managed by Swire Hotels. Our room was very large, well designed with wonderful views. It had a comfortable sitting area and massive bathroom. After a long flight I just loved taking a relaxing bath, gazing out at the view and catching up on a bit of TV secretly housed behind a mirror panel. So unique to enjoy a hotel bathroom with amazing views and natural light. Luxury bedding, complimentary minibar and wifi are other features to enjoy. We stayed in a Studio 70 room. The whole hotel is exquisite - with thoughtful well executed minimalist design. The artwork throughout the hotel is superb. The technology in the rooms is cutting edge. The service was excellent - so nice to be taken to our room for check-in. There is a beautiful library and a lovely cafe/bar area with extensive views of Hong Kong. We will definitely be returning to the Upper House next time we are in Hong Kong and would highly recommend it as one of the best boutique hotels we have ever enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels”
Reviews.Author: catb14
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing. From the moment you stepped in the hotel you are relaxed. The rooms are luxurious and the service is excellent. I had room service and the quality of food was outstanding. Also the little things like biscuits, peanuts and soft drinks all included in the price as well as a cosmetics bag with qualilty products which you can take away. Overall I can't fault this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very very attentive service, huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: Traveleator
Reviews.Content: I was recommended to stay at this hotel by my colleague who claims that it is one of the best hotels that he has stayed at. Upon checking in I wondered why he was so ga-ga about this place. Having stayed at the Shangri-la across the road and Marriott under Upper House, my initial reaction was very much neutral. The hotel is in the same Pacific Place complex as Marriott, Shangri-la and Conrad, doesn't have a swimming pool, has a small gym on the 48th level and a restaurant on the topmost level - 49th. Enough, I'll now explain why this hotel features in the top 3 in HK. Firstly, for business travellers the free high speed wi-fi access is a great boon, most other hotels in this category charge hefty fees. Secondly, the mini-bar (which they call maxi-bar and stocks beers, juices, sparking water) is compliments of the hotel except for the wines. Thirdly, the smallest room of 70 sqm is bigger than most hotel rooms in HK; I had a king sized bed, an L shaped sofa in the bedroom with a writing desk, iPod loaded with music and connected to the jewel speakers in the room. The bedroom opens into by far the largest wardrobe, bathroom area I've seen in any business hotel. The bathroom has a shower area and a bathtube to the side facing a TV for leisure. Now coming to the service, the check in is the best that I've ever come across, you don't have to wait in queues at the reception, one of the staff comes up with you to your room where you can relax on your couch with your welcome drink whilst he runs you through the check in procedure on his iPad. I had requested for a few sachets of English breakfast tea and guess what, every night, I had 4-5 sachets of English breakfast in my cabinet. Also, on the first night, I removed all the water bottles from the bar to ensure that they revert to room temperature as I am not in a habit of drinking cold water, from day 2 (and I stayed there for 11 days), all water replacements were left out. They clean the room in the morning but return for turndown service in the evening where they draw the curtains in the bedroom and bathroom (make sure that you do so because the glass is see-through at night). Water is placed beside the side of the bed where I slept and bathroom slippers neatly placed underneath. Cafe Gray has superb views of HK and Kowloon harbour. The breakfast options are extensive and the dinner was quite good. They have an extensive wine collection. The restaurant and the bar are open to non-hotel guests as well. The only recommendation that I do have for the hotel is to give another phone on writing desk that is a regular wire-connected phone. The reason I say so is because on the first night my wireless phone was not connected properly. I couldn't make any calls and had to use the phone in the restroom. The next evening I had to call a hotel representative to the room who came and connected the phone and I could then only make calls after the cordless had charged. Would be nice to have a back up in the room. All in all, wonderful service at this boutique, highend business hotel. Would certainly come back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: eddeeng
Reviews.Content: I have been to HK many times and have stayed at a number of hotels there incl the Four Seasons. This is the first occasion where I can say that the level of service has bowled me over. I was there with my two sons and even though the hotel is very much geared for business travellers, it made every effort to make sure that my boys were well taken care of. Examples would include getting them kid size slippers. The staff made it a point to remember our plans for the day and to enquire about them. The room was large and had a wonderful view. Our every need was taken care of. I wil certainly make a repeat visit.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch - one of the best in the world”
Reviews.Author: MrApril
Reviews.Content: Had an opportunity to stay in the hotel while our home in Hong Kong needed some renovation work done. While we have visited the Upper House for drinks and dinners before, one would not appreciate this wonderful hotel until spending some nights there. My wife and I travel often and spend way too much time in hotels around the world, The Upper House is an instant classic, well done for the staff and management for making Hong Kong proud of having another world-class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Okker
Reviews.Content: Great location with great views - best of all was the shower (best ever) and the bed was just so right. Cafe Grey was worth a re-visit too. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, again”
Reviews.Author: Mr&MrsWilko
Reviews.Content: Second time at the Upper House. It is an amazing hotel. The rooms are very well appointed - very comfortable beds; good sofa area; good desk area, excellent wifi; and excellent bathrooms. Great free snacks and toiletries provided in the rooms. Hotel has very nice outside garden, great restaurant and nice bar too. The staff have a great service culture and are really keen to help you and make your stay as easy and as pleasant as possible. Also, impressed that they try hard to remember your name and use it. Location is really good - just a few minutes walk to the Admiralty metro stop - and that is a good stop for getting around HK island and over to Kowloon. Very much hope to return!

Reviews.Title: “An exemplary hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Whiskie8
Reviews.Content: What more could I say about this hotel! As the staff say – our house is your home. This was certainly the case from reservation through to post-stay follow up. An exemplary experience. No wonder it has been included in the 2012 Conde Nast list for best hotel room in the world. We are very regular international business travellers and the Trip Advisor contributors gave us confidence to stay here for a short vacation – and we had high expectations. The hotel surpassed these. Nothing was a bother, everything done with a smile and thought. Whether it be organising a booking at a nearby top restaurant (and unbeknown to us organising a premium window table) to booking four people into Cafe Grey for dinner at 30min notice on a Friday evening to supplying a zippered travel bag to use for extra luggage. The rooms are HUGE (by any city’s standard, but especially in Hong Kong). More like an apartment with a large privacy door between the dressing, bathroom and toilet area. The insulation was so good that you could not hear anyone from part of the room/suite or guests in any adjacent rooms. Although contributors have kindly shared their photos I have added only one (of the view from window). At check in we were met by Paul who personally escorted us to the room and gave an orientation. Complimentary bar fridge, Illy coffee pod machine and snacks in appropriately named containers (like ’yummy’ for the baby M&Ms). Wonderful REN products through the bathroom and a giant bathtub (including bath salts and grooming products) with separate TV to watch or listen to your ipod. There was also a huge walk in Vichy shower. A real treat. Although we ate at a number of top restaurants, we found Cafe Grey (on level49) to have a very high standard – both for breakfast and dinner. Very generous and wide range of choice for breakfast, good coffee (hard to find in Hong Kong) and wonderful dinner (the salmon and chicken main courses were highlights for me). It was a different world to the adjacent Marriott hotel. More intimate, calm and personal... and for a similar price. To me there was no comparison. I can’t wait to return and separately to plan a trip to stay in Beijing at the sister hotel, the Opposite House

Reviews.Title: “First class service on a first class hotel”
Reviews.Author: feistera
Reviews.Content: I visit my friend for lunch and wine here. The service was amazing. The room is sick, not your typical one. Love the bathroom view ofnthe city. Love the restaurant on the rooftop of the hotel. Excellent

Reviews.Title: “Cafe Grey at the Upper House”
Reviews.Author: wornoutmummy
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for lunch as well as dinner, you need to book. It is located on the top floor and the service and decor are fantastic. The food is of very high quality , presentation is great. A visit to the bathroom is a must for the ladies !! Its not the cheapest place in town, but is a great place to take the girls for lunch .

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have been in for a long time.”
Reviews.Author: luke_speedos
Reviews.Content: I have not been pleasantly surprised by a hotel room for a long time ! As others have said, a very different hotel. Note that some taxi drivers do not know this place, but this is just opposite Shangri-La. Soft drinks/water and peanuts etc are free in the mini-bar which is very handy for travellers. Bathroom is exceptional, can't describe it here enough. Wonderful ambience. good connectivity for IT. Lots of little things provided - thus convenient for a business traveller. Helpful staff as well, even though there are not many of them to be seen. A bit on the expensive side though. Gym is a bit small. No swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Location ? Yes, but also the staff !”
Reviews.Author: Michael W
Reviews.Content: Yes, the Upper House is well located, offers a superb view (junior suites especially), very "boutique-design" rooms, with all comfort, and basically all you would expect from a (rather) expensive place to stay. So why the Upper House and not one of the other Hong Kong hotels with similar rooms ? Because of the staff. From management to bar staff, all are efficient and friendly. Not always the case in HK !

Reviews.Title: “High tea”
Reviews.Author: imochichi
Reviews.Content: Hv a afternoon tea here, so good High level view of Kowloon. 3layer tea set ( sweet n salty), scone with a drink. Relax and luxury! If u love high tea, try here.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best in Asia”
Reviews.Author: Brendanmclarke
Reviews.Content: For anyone traveling to Hong Kong, this is the hotel that you must consider. Everything from the service to the location to the design is done with the most care and attention to detail. This is certainly going to cost more than most major chains, but the value you receive for that money is well worth it. I will be back here for all of my future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Goetz79
Reviews.Content: my real Home away from Home in Hong Kong. Most spacious rooms, perfect service and all you need. Much more Boutique than the large Hotels in the city and much more personal.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: cobba19
Reviews.Content: My husband & I recently celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary at The Upper House & highly recommend it. We were upgraded to the honeymoon suite consisting of a huge bedroom with the bed being in the middle of the room & a dressing/wardrobe area behind. A large lounge/dining area with magnificent views over to Kowloon. The bathroom was enormous with a huge vanity area separate to the bath & shower. Very modern, with Ren products (from eye cream to cleansers etc) even a lovely small wooden hairbrush. The only thing that was missing was a make-up mirror. Free access to wifi & the mini bar except for the wine & jars of m&m’s, biscuits, mentos & nuts to nibble on. We had a plate of chocolate coated strawberries waiting for us when we first arrived too. Unfortunately we both contacted the flu & needed to see a doctor. They were able to have a doctor in our room within ½ hour. There is a lovely garden area to sit & have a coffee but the downfall is it’s a smoking area as well. On our last night we ate at Café Grey…. unbelievable. The setting & atmosphere is just perfect. The food delicious, pricey but worth it. We had the use of a lovely shopping bag they left in our room as well as an IPod touch system for ordering room service etc. The attention to detail & the attitude of the staff are very high. We were given a scented candle, a leather bound diary & a perfumed room spray which was a nice touch to leave on. This hotel is a 5 star plus so expect to pay top dollar, but it’s so worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: DaKe72
Reviews.Content: I stayed for the first time in the Upper House in HK, which was recommended by a friend. It will not be the last time. The rooms are spacious and well-equipped, the staff is super friendly and the location is just great. It feels like home away from home. This boutique hotel is just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Big...Very well thought out....great!!!”
Reviews.Author: smclagan
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights at The Upper House and loved it. Room was huge and very well appointed and as others have mentioned full of surprises. Service was great especially helpfull when the gentleman who drove us from the airport offered to drive us to help us make our dinner reservation when a taxi was not available. Scrambled egg with caviar on brioche with great coffee and amazing view in Cafe Grey Delux was a morning treat as was the nightcap cocktail in the bar after a day of adventures. Could not fault and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “A Second Home”
Reviews.Author: Omar F
Reviews.Content: I've been to the Upper House on a number of occasions and every single time has been perfect. The staff are superb, the rooms are beyond comfortable and the level of service is second to none. On top of this I'm always made to feel as if I'm coming back home whenever I visit. This is definitely one of my favourite, if not my favourite, hotels I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Without a doubt, the best hotel experience you can find.”
Reviews.Author: DMidalia
Reviews.Content: We actually live in Hong Kong, but after seeing the hotel room of a visiting guest we decided the next special occasion we had we would treat ourselves. The rooms, staff, and hotel are all simply extraordinary. There is not a thing that The Upper House have not thought of here - personalized iPods, luxurious & plentiful toiletries, complimentary room refreshments, iPad check-in, even complimentary weekend yoga! The attention to detail, quality of design & beyond 5-star service are complimented by the exceptional Cafe Grey restaurant & bar, making it complete and utter luxury. Even the smallest rooms on offer give the feeling of your own apartment!! Both Marcel and Nicholas looked after us generously throughout our stay - with early check in, late check out, personal messages & complimentary gifts - we didn't want to leave. I hope to return very soon, there's simply nothing else like it.

Reviews.Title: “Favourite”
Reviews.Author: Mitchpa
Reviews.Content: A great hotel our favorite Great design and features everything is good about the Upper House

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel2747
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff made our Hong Kong stay of 4 nights ones to remember. We had a corner suite that was fantastic. I thought at first I would be disappointed not facing the Bay, but after seeing it at night and morning, we were definately happy. (The staff did call after about 15 minutes to say there was a cancellation of a hotel room on the Bay side. We decided to keep our suite and are so happy we did.) As the others have said, this is the best hotel ever!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fanstastic Experience at Upperhouse”
Reviews.Author: Alvin C
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but only good things to say about this hotel. Hotel and staff were in a different class from many 5 stars hotels. I give it a six star service. Have travelled to many hotels and rarely write reviews or feedback but Upperhouse desereves a special mention. For me aside on the fact they have one of the best rooms in hong kong its more their personal and professional service they provided. Their staff across the board are as accomodating as you can find from reservations to their guest experience staff. The fact the hotel is a big hotel and am sure they have a lot of people and things to attend to yet you feel like they treat you as their VIP customer and that your comfort comes first before anything else. True a fanstatic experience and because of that will be back in May.

Reviews.Title: “How soon can we go back? Best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: groover79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Upper House as a stopover when relocating permanently from London to Sydney. This place blew us away in every area of comfort, style, luxury and hospitality. From the welcome to the farewell the Upper House was faultless. Our room was huge and the bathroom was ultimate luxury. The little self serve mini bar is a nice touch (but perhaps too tempting with free m&m's!!!). Bed was really comfy and we had heaps of room with our three year old also having her end in the studio. She had her own little pair of slippers and thought she could stay forever! Location was superb and the staff (all of them) were every day so extremely helpful. In our departure we had the whole team waving goodbye and our daughter felt like royalty! Seriously can't rate this place highly enough but only suggest you go there and see/experience it for yourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Vicki N
Reviews.Content: Almost hate to share this hidden gem of a hotel. We've stayed at fine hotels around the world and The Upper House is at the top of our list. From its incredibly friendly and efficient staff to the huge rooms with amazing views to the "extras" like espresso machines in the room as well as a "maxibar" stocked with free soft drinks, water, juices, cookies, chocolate, nuts, etc, the Upper House Has taken luxury and comfort to the next level. Be sure to arrange a dinner at Cafe Gray Deluxe on the 49th floor for food so good it will make you forget to look across the Harbor at the light show of Kowloon. This hotel has thought of everything to make your Hong Kong experience wonderful. They even provide guest Octopuss cards to save you time of standing in line at the ferries or tram. Thank you staff of Upper House ( especially Nicholas & Benny in Guest Experience and Karen at Cafe Gray) for an incredible stay - have you thought of adding branches in other cities? We'll be the first to reserve!

Reviews.Title: “For Business or Pleasure, the Perfect City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Consigliera-S
Reviews.Content: “One of the best city hotels I’ve stayed, hands down, ever. Not easy to top some of Hong Kong’s classics – but it is at least on par with the very best. The management clearly gets it right – from the subdued service to the sparkling interiors to the excellent cuisine. I can’t wait to return and bring my wife who keeps hearing me go on about it!”

Reviews.Title: “Exemplary”
Reviews.Author: JohnCurrie
Reviews.Content: I stay in quite a few hotels and don't really take the time to write reviews but Upper House deserves a special mention. It is a haven of chic and tranquility without any of the ‘overly trendy’ extras you sometimes find in boutique hotels. It feels calm, private, understated and generally a haven of peace and tranquility in the bustle of Hong Kong. Hand written cards together with fresh cookies are the small things which make you feel special. I am 3 nights into a 4 night business trip stay and genuinely looking forward to returning after leaving the office tonight. I am going to be travelling to Hong Kong around 4 times a year with having a team here now and I will certainly not be shopping around for another hotel. Brilliant first impression and look forward to returning soon. Thanks - I will return.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Billybuchman
Reviews.Content: Beautiful - very big rooms, comfortable beds, everything is electronic, room service is ordered from an iPod, and mini bar items (excluding wine, champagne and spirits) are all included. Staff are very attentive - if you speak to someone even once, they will remember your name. Restaurant staff were a little overwhelmed when the breakfast rush was at its peak on a weekend however their attitude could not be faulted and the views from the 49th floor are worth waiting for. Hard to get a cab owing to the location being at the end of a loop with 3 other hotel/shopping center ranks before it, but the MTR is literally below the hotel. Expensive, but definitely worth it. Previously we stayed exclusively at the Four Seasons in Central but this has just blown that out of the water. You know you are staying somewhere special when Owen Wilson is sitting at the next table having breakfast wearing slippers.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: karen p
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved the Upper House and will definitely stay here again if we are ever in Hong Kong. All the pros: -beautifully decorated, modern, spacious room with great amenities - REN bath products, shower with a rainshower spout, bathtub, TV in the bathroom, tons of closet space, comfortable beds -location is Pacific Place, right next to the JW Marriott, Conrad, Shangri-La and the Pacific Place shopping. MTR subway is right there too. Super close to everything in Central HK -Cafe Grey in this hotel has amazing views and great food, albeit pricey -excellent service and staff - free yoga in the mornings, and coffee throughout the day, and they make up your room 2x a day Only con is that the free wifi is slow at times but we loved it nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down the best hotel in Central Area of HK”
Reviews.Author: love2travel2world
Reviews.Content: It's located above the JW Marriott and is so special... any place where the mini bar is included (includng beers), that's comfortable and spacious has got to be special in Central. I prefer this place to the Four Seasons. I have stayed the most at the JW Marriott which isn't bad but just can't compare with the level of this hotel (despite being located directly below it). They check you in from your room which is a nice touch. I plan to mimic the bath and tub in my dream bathroom in my dreamhouse one day. I can't say enough nice things about this place. It's definitely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and fun”
Reviews.Author: Charlie1001
Reviews.Content: You have to like this place. The hotel has been turned upside down - there is no conventional lobby on arrival and instead of the usual check in procedures one is taken to the room and checked in on an iPad. The guest services which one would normally find in a hotel lobby are on the top floor with amazing views of Hong Kong from 40 floors up. The excellent restaurant and bar is on the same floor. The rooms are all very large (70 sqm for even the smallest rooms) and the views consistently good. Even the bathrooms have floor to ceiling windows with great views (but take note of the sign which says that the windows are two way glass - the great views could go in both directions!). It is not all perfect - room service breakfast was chaotic and at some times of the day there were lengthy waits for taxis as the hotel is in Pacific Place - but overall this is a great hotel and a fun place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Simply put... the BEST boutique hotel in the world.”
Reviews.Author: CryingMan
Reviews.Content: Ok. Ok. I don't blame you if you read this and figure I work at the Upper House... or my brother-in-law Moe is the General Manager... or I have some vested interest in the property. Well, I don't, he isn't, I don't. Now I can riff. The Upper House is hands-down THE BEST boutique hotel I have ever experienced. In the opinion of this seasoned, world traveler, it is one of the BEST hotels, large or small, in the world. Upon arrival my wife, son, daughter-in-law and I were warmly and sincerely greeted by staff... awaiting us at the Porte-cochère. Our first glimpse of the property was the warm and inviting entrance. Dancing modern flame posts-lights illuminated the stone sculptures and raked grey-sand Zen gardens. Our "dedicated" greeter seemed to know us. At the Reception Counter the General Manager happened to be there (where wasn't he we later realized... everywhere at the same time it seemed... the very best type of management at a property like this... I call it "management-by-walking-around."). He and our greeters had a momentary discussion, she then said, "You are a family. We don't want to put you in two separate rooms. We want you stay in our Penthouse at no additional charge." Really!?! Our rooms (2 of them) were Studio 70 rooms, looked beautiful but they were The Upper House lowest-cost room type at HK$4500 per night. These folks were upgrading us to a HK$30,000 per night Penthouse at the Studio 70 price so that my family could be together. We neither asked for nor expected anything. WOW. We were escorted by Peggy (the Pleasant) up the long escalator to a secondary little lobby. Beautiful stone sculptures abound. More flaming post lighting. Past a Starbucks-like private cafe counter (for hotel guests). Even the elevators were beautifully appointed with soft lighting and artwork. We were shown to Room 4805. The hallways were softly and warmly lit. More sculptures... and into the Penthouse. Un. Be. Li. Va. Bull. The Penthouse was magnificent! Warm, inviting, comfortable furnishings. Two beautiful bedrooms. Views of the harbor and the city and the peaks (almost 360 degrees). The bathrooms were large with room-sized showers, large soaking tub, great amenities. They brought us tea and pastries. The room had a well-stocked bar (all free except the wine), gourmet cartridge-type coffee machine, cannisters of candy bars and bags, Milano cookies, granola bars, and more. The sound system and much of the room functionality it controlled by an iPod Touch. Fantastic, comfortable, quiet, spotlessly-clean, well-appointed rooms. The staff could not do enough for us throughout our stay. We asked where an ATM was... they walked us to it across the street. The GM stopped by at our breakfast table the first morning. We chatted for 20 minutes. He kept referencing things to do and see... then he just walked away and returned with a Luxe tour book box-set which he asked us to accept with his compliments (that's about a US$25 set). On the last night of our stay (my son and his wife were staying two more days... and The Upper House insisted they stay on in the Penthouse) we found two fine-quality leather tote bags in the living room, each with a beautiful, boxed, scented candle gift wrapped inside the tote. And did I mention the warm milk and homemade cookies set out every night in our rooms? I just can't say enough. I've stayed at three other fine hotels in Hong Kong in years past... all 5 star... all with impeccable reputations and truly great service/rooms. I will, going forward, ONLY stay at The Upper House... and it will be the boutique hotel that I measure all others throughout the world by.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service, location and room”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer C
Reviews.Content: Upper house is beyond amazing. I stayed in Hong Kong for 8 days in 3 hotels. The first couple nights I stayed at Marriott near the airport which was pretty good too but very standard room in Hong Kong. Then I stayed one night in Hyatt in grand central and that experience was pretty bad because the hotel is really old and the suite was really small compared to the money spent. The remaining nights I stayed at Uppder House and the experience was EXCELLENT. ROOM: The room is double of the size compared to the regular rooms in most of 4 or 5 star Hong Kong hotels although half of the room is used for bathroom space. I love the free snack and drink bar especially when I returned to the hotel late at night. The Hotel uses "REN" skincare products and I LOVE IT! They gave you one cosmetic bag full of REN products everyday even though you don't finish them. I had harbor veiw 70 room and the view is really amazing. I also loved the sitting area next to the huge windows over looking the ocean. I had my coffee and snack early in the morning or late at night looking at the view and listening to the iPod jazz songs the hotel provides. They also provide free wifi. SERVICE: The customer service is amazing too. I had a package delivered oversea and the front desk helped me to track it while I was out. When I returned, it was sitting on my desk already. Anything I asked, they figured it out for me with very professional manner. FOOD: I went to the 49th floor for breakfast and I wouldn't recommend it. There are TONS of good food out there. The breakfast was fancy but wayyyy over priced. LOCATION: Excellent location. It's right next to Marriott and connected to Pacific Place which is one of the stops of subway, but it has the quietness outside of the busy mall. In my opinion, the location is great. The ONLY thing I am a little bit disappointed is Upper House is sort of like an "Apartment" not really a "hotel", so it gives you lots of comfort feeling of a "home", so maybe that's the reason they don't have pool and spa. Therefore, I went to spas at both Mandarin Oriental and Ritz-Carlton. If you don't care about the 116th floors ocean view of Ritz-Cariton, you should consider going to the spa in Mandarin Oriental which is much better. I love their extra facilities and relaxation room. If you are willing to spend a little extra money, Upper House is definitely your choice.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: CathyZRH
Reviews.Content: It was my second time visiting The Upper House but it was the first time I have spent two nights in the Hotel. The location of the hotel is very good. It does not take long to tourists attraction as well it does not take long to causeway bay. We have had a really nice and spacious room where nothing was missing. If you are visiting this hotel, do not forget to take a drink in the bar and enjoy the wonderful view to Kowloon. As well the restaurant is a very good address. I wish I could spend more time at this wonderful place.

Reviews.Title: “Best service ever !”
Reviews.Author: MayfairLady1
Reviews.Content: Hands down from arrival to departure the best service we have ever experienced. It was almost like they were reading your mind... Both at the Cocktail bar with amazing views, as in the wonderful Restaurant we were stunned by the spotless-perfect service. Thanks so much for a wonderful experience!!! Made our weekend-stay in HK a wonderful experience and we'd always come back...

Reviews.Title: “THE worldwide urban SANCTUARY...”
Reviews.Author: ccrr77fr
Reviews.Content: What is a sanctuary for me? A place where the most beautiful design meets the most impressive and ultimate comfort. It's also a place where you'll find a dedicated team trying their really best to anticipate all your needs and providing the highest standard of service. Consequently, it's really hard to find a sanctuary and more especially in a city where, usually, people are always in a rush. A sanctuary is also a kind of cocoon, a "home sweet home" where leaving from is so hard... It's something so special like a gem and when you find one, trust me, it gives a very amazing emotion... A few days ago, maybe i've had one of the most incredible emotion of my life cause i not only find a urban sanctuary but THE urban sanctuary, the place i consider as the most fantastic city hotel of the world where everything has exceeded all the expectations. First of all, The Upper House is superbly located between Central and Causeway Bay, up to the most elegant mall of Hong Kong. It offers stunning views on the bay but on the city as well and do not think the mountain view is uninteresting cause all the rooms facing the mountain offers a green breathtaking scenery and actually this is maybe my favorite view cause it's so relaxing. All the accommodations of this very special and exclusive hotel are just amazing. Starting with 700sq. feet, all the studios and suites will be a peaceful and very elegant retreat during your entire stay. The Upper House has been designed by the very talented Andre Fu and the result is more than exquisite. The choice for materials is excellent and you'll fall in love for the scheme of colors melting light green with purple, grey and bright wood. Everything is beautiful and just unique and what to say about the bathrooms... I almost lost my voice the first time i saw the most sexiest bathrooms in the world with an elevated water area with a deep bathtub and a fabulous view on the city. The Upper House is also the place where you'll find the most exclusive amenities ever. A very good selection of REN products but a very special comfort kit as well comparable as the one you could find in the best Airline First Class, a beautiful shopping bag and a very practical travel bag. I've been just impressed by it and hot milk and cookies during the turn down service is really well thinking. I loved the complimentary maxi bar with jar of candies and cookies replenished every day. very very special... So, let's say i've been again so satisfied about this hotel which has a very important space in my heart. However, after my first visit, THE urban sanctuary as i like to qualificate this hotel, i complained a bit about the service which was not as good as i expected. This new visit erased the impression of my first visit a few years ago. Now, the team of The Upper House is absolutely amazing. Each person working in this hotel is incredibly nice, friendly and professional. They really don't stop to try their best to make your stay unforgettable and memorable. Everybody will greet you by your name with always a nice word. It's remarkable how great is the improvement and the management team headed by Dean Winter is simply fantastic. The Guest Relations manager Paul is adorable and he really makes our time in this property the most delightful time of our life.... I really want to thank all this team for this great job. Now you understand that a stay at The Upper House is one of the most special thing to do in a life. Nothing can be better in Hong Kong, in Asia, in the world. This property is the most beautiful possible and you'll be treated as somebody very special at each second of your stay. It's not so pricey if you consider this is THE hotel experience of your life. just FANTASTIC... I'm total FAN...

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: NomadSoul88
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is really very, very nice!! The rooms and bathrooms are uber sexy and trendy and this has made us come back here. Staff is very professional and helpful. I have a gluten intolerance so I went to their restaurant and I asked what gluten free options they could reccomend me. Upon returning to my room, I found a freshly printed gluten free menu with my name on it, so it's easier for me to decide and order food in the future. Pretty awsome service :) I gave the hotel a 4 star rating because unlike The Shangri-La, Marriott, Conrad and Four Seasons it doesn't have direct access to the Mall. Also, it doesn't have a SPA, a swiming pool, and your dining options are pretty limited to only one restaurant/cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on Hong Kong island”
Reviews.Author: HopingThisHelps
Reviews.Content: for space, comfort and ambience. Newer and more comfortable design than Four Seasons, Conrad, and Shangri-la, but quite pricey!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel for the business traveller”
Reviews.Author: Howards19
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 5 night stay at The Upper House. I have been a regular visitor to Hong Kong over the years and usually stay at one of the other hotels in Pacific Place. On this occasion I thought I would give The Upper House a try. I certainly did not regret doing so. This is a fine hotel by any standards. The staff are young and eager to please without being obsequious and the check in and check out procedures are effortless. The hotel is peaceful and relaxing, the rooms wonderful (previous reviews have said it all), and the sole restaurant, Cafe Gray, a haven. Breakfasts were always a pleasure, as were the two dinners I enjoyed. The hotel is a triumph of both style and substance and any criticism seems churlish - just occasionally though style wins over substance. For example, if you want to watch TV when in the bath (and why ruin a good bath ?) then you have to sit at the plug and overflow end, with associated discomfort. Also the positioning of the washbasin in the loo cubicle is bizarre - it's far too close to the seat and would have been better placed on the opposite wall. These are, however, truly minor strictures in the context of a wonderful hotel which I would unreservedly recommend to the business traveller. One last point -it's location on a one way circuit serving 4 hotels means that at peak times it is difficult to get a cab. The staff recognise this and go to extraordinary lengths to commandeer cabs at the start of the circuit much to the chagrin, I imagine, of the other hotels. Au revoir The Upper House - I'll be back next year. Don't change anything!

Reviews.Title: “best boutquie hotel in Town”
Reviews.Author: q8engrchina
Reviews.Content: hotel was amazing. Rooms are modern with nice wood style. room was specious. speratre jaccuz and walk in closet. and separate bathroom. view was nice. and roomon 43 floor. GYM is nice but small. no swimming pool. that was disadvantage. Cafe grey is perfect dinner in HK. breakfast was nice but small portions,

Reviews.Title: “Regular visitor: I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: alexs_73
Reviews.Content: I work one week per month in Hong Kong and have stayed in this hotel seven times. The rooms are really comfortable, the staff are extremely helpful and the views are amazing. And nothing beats a few beers in the bath after a long day in the office looking out over the harbour and watching the telly. At HK$150 the cheese and ham toastie in the 48th floor bar (not on the menu but available) is ridiculously expensive but this is Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: SCP888
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting Hong Kong for nearly 18 years (and lived there for some of that time). Over the years I have been a regular at The Mandarin Oriental and have also used The Landmark Oriental, The Island Shangri-La, The Conrad and The Grand Hyatt. What makes The Upper House special is the sheer size and luxury of the rooms and the outstanding staff. This was our second stay and we had booked a 70 square metre harbour view room. We were upgraded to an 80 square metre harbour view but asked to be downgraded again. The 80 sq. m. rooms are at the ends of the building and the one we were shown looked out on to other tall buildings - by contrast the 70 sq. m. rooms we have used were in the centre of the building with very good views of Victoria Harbour. The "maxi bar"is well stocked and the bathroom and dressing room are great for wallowing in. If you want large marbled reception areas and big pools and gyms, this hotel is not for you but if you want a centrally located luxury hotel and really don't need much more than the room this is worth considering. It is not cheap but prices are in line with the other centrally located hotels on Hong Kong Island and the rooms are much bigger. The staff are young and enthusiastic. Somehow they seem to remember your name and nothing is too much trouble. Breakfasts in Cafe Gray on the 49th floor are not cheap - around USD 68 for two - but are from an a la carte menu (no buffet) and cooked to order. If you want a cheaper option there is a coffee shop (Cova Coffee) on the 4th floor of Pacific Place mall on top of which the hotel stands. There is also a cafe that serves breakfast at geEAT (that's how it's spelt) which is attached to the food supermarket in the basement of the mall. The rooms have kettles, coffee maker, toaster, cutlery and crockery so you could always buy your breakfast from the supermarket (the shop opens at 10.00 a.m. but the cafe opens much earlier) and eat it sitting on the sofa of your room gazing out over the harbour. We'll be back in March for our third visit. What more can I say.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: singmaster
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! It ranks as one of my top five for sure. Great location, free snacks and beer, the amazing bath tub and fantastic service. Do I wish it had a pool? Yes. But it's Hong Kong, they are tough to come by. Do I wish the gym was a little bigger? Yes, but it was totally fine for my needs. OH and the restaurant. So good. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Superb on every level”
Reviews.Author: Whistleforit
Reviews.Content: We stay in Hong Kong 6-7 times year and this is by far the best hotel on the island. The service is great and the rooms fantastic. The only gripe? A spa would be fantastic

Reviews.Title: “My home in Hong Kong!”
Reviews.Author: hitoridemo3
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many beautiful hotels in Hong Kong, but I wanted something different and exclusive. My friend suggested the Upper House, and I tried. It is located next to Conrad and Marriott, but had a definitely different atmosphere and a bit like a hideaway. The hotel makes you feel like a special person, and they treat you that way with personal attention. Upon arrival, I had reserved a standard room, but somehow they upgraded me to a huge suite. The standard room is already large to begin with, but the suite was huge. I had 8 guests come over to spend in my living room, and we all sat on the sofa very comfortably. The bathroom was surrounded by windows and I enjoyed the panoramic views while bathing. I was told not to forget closing the automatic shades when bathing after dark... The rooms are very simple designed, and thats what I like. But the amenities were very stylish and they even offered playing cards... The mini bar was all free, and they had candys and chocolates, and toilettry kit for takeaway. I loved the bathrobe, so I decided to buy one. There were few areas I found needs improvement. The carpet was stained, and some staffs seemed unexperienced. I had to wait more than 5 ringtones until the front desk answered my call. But all these were covered by all the positive aspects. The real downside for me was that they had no swimming pool and a tiny fitness room, but I was so busy that I did not have time even if they had those features. So if you are bringing children who wants to play at the pool, this is not for you. I was there for business, but I definitely would want to return next for holiday with my wife. They have a nice restaurant called Cafe Gray Deluxe, but I thought it could be better. The hotel is located by the cliffs, and my room had spectacular views of the bay, the city, and the mountains. It is near Admiralty on Hong Kong side, and just 5 minutes away by taxi from the convention center. If you want the hustle bustle excitement of Tsim sha tsui, then I don't think the location is very convenient, but if you want a quiet and peaceful atmosphere, I would recommend the Upper House. Its close to the financial district too, so good for executives on business. The rates are quite expensive, and some writes that its not worth what you are paying for, but even if I was not upgraded, I will still be satisfied with what I paid. The Upper House will be my home in Hong Kong, where I can get away from the crowd and spend time in peace and comfort. It is a hotel that makes you feel very special!

Reviews.Title: “hip hotel with great rooms”
Reviews.Author: JenAndAndrew
Reviews.Content: what a great addition this has been to the HK hotel scene! Love: 1. the size of the rooms - they are HUGE with the most amazing bathroom/change areas 2. great view from most rooms 3. free snacks and drinks in the room 4. Cafe Grey is excellent and the bar is lots of fun 5. refreshing room service menu - lots more healthy choices and not just usual mundane hotel fare 6. right above Pacific Place so very convenient for shopping :-) 7. competitve room rate when compared to hotels in the middle of Central Downsides: 1. if you are there for business, it is not as convenient as being right in Central 2. the gym is tiny 3. the service tends to be more hip than polished so depends on what you like

Reviews.Title: “Lovely modern hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: alondongirl
Reviews.Content: Very modern hotel. Room is very nice, service is good (if a little too "cool"). Restaurant is mediocre but good for drinks. Nice view, good location next to Pacific Place (big upscale shopping mall) and close to PP3 where there are cute boutique and nice restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Oasis of Calm”
Reviews.Author: LaineBee14
Reviews.Content: The quality of the design (excellent) is only surpassed by the service - friendly, obliging staff - they go the extra mile to be helpful. In such a frantic city, wonderful to come 'home' to.

Reviews.Title: “Small, excellent hotel with focus on service”
Reviews.Author: MCP247
Reviews.Content: Very quiet, minimalist and modern hotel. Hotel services via iPad and iPod touch. Fantastic restaurant with great views. Super bathrooms, Ren products and full toiletries bag provided. Central location. Smaller alternative to corporate hotels

Reviews.Title: “Big room and great location!”
Reviews.Author: doverproperty
Reviews.Content: The room is very big by HK's standard and it was a great stay to say the least. Check-in was done in the room itself and the service staff are young and enthusiastic. The bathroom itself is very huge as well. Each room can certainly squeeze 3 people comfortably. It is located above Pacific Place so all major sights are not too far away. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in the World”
Reviews.Author: Gareth W
Reviews.Content: The Upper House is an incredible hotel. I have been very fortunate to stay in many iconic hotels around the World but there is no doubt in my mind that currently this is the World's best hotel. The service is seamless - in advance of your stay you get to advise of preferences. Then your guest experience executive looks after you throughout your stay - Peggy in my case who is a delight. Upper House support Apple well, check-in is on an Ipad, you order room service through an Ipod Touch. Peggy was constantly in touch to ensure that everything was ok and then each evening I was given cookies and warm milk to help me sleep. The rooms are 70 square metres plus with an unbelievable view of the Hong Kong skyline from room and bathroom. The bathroom, walk-in wardrobe, products, maxi-bar so many touches that you do not get elsewhere even in the 5* plus luxury hotel market. I could go on and on, you need to visit Hong Kong and try it first hand - I'm pleased I live just 2 hours flight away so can return soon. The General Manager Dean and his engaged team should be very proud of their efforts and of the experiences they are creating day in day out.

Reviews.Title: “Possible the best in the world”
Reviews.Author: JoseTeh_travels
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel. Rooms perfect and large. Amenities that I ended up buying on line after my stay. Staff that were friendly and extremely helpful. 5stars all the way (inc the price tag. But worth splashing out) Lastly views to die for!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in HK”
Reviews.Author: mal p
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel experiance I have ever had, attention to detail, service of the team at the upper house is unbeatable. Yes its expensive, Yes theres a feeling of exclusivity, but then it also feels like value for money!!!! why you ask, becasue there is no price to put on outstanding service. Paul Stanton and his team deliver on every measure in every way. This will be my new and only hotel in HK when i travel

Reviews.Title: “My favourite urban hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: AlastairCookieNYC
Reviews.Content: The Upper House is my favourite hotel in a city anywhere. The first and most notable thing is the staff - every member of the team is attentive without being overbearing, they go the extra mile, they respond to every request quickly and efficiently and with professional enthusiasm, PLUS the hotel is so well managed many things that contribute to a comfortable stay have been pre-emptively thought of so you don't even have to ask. Some small but random details: The hotel is immaculately clean without ever smelling of cleaning products. I am allergic to dust and mould and also to chemical frangrances and the upper house housekeeping team do an incredible job. They have good quality tea in silk bag tea bags in the room - this is a small but noticeable detail and a huge improvement on most hotels providing paper-bag Liptons or Twinings. They provide elegant unisex toiletry travel kits in the bathrooms with excellent REN face products, hand sanitizer, mouth wash, toothbrush etc. There is a decent nail file and nail polish remover wipes. They think of EVERYTHING! They chose REN products for the shower, body and hair care, plus bath salts and oils. REN is a high quality beauty brand made from natural ingredients, with no synthetic fragrances, perfect for anyone who is sensitive to chemicals or has allergies, plus just a quality product in general. My husband loved the products too. Finally, and rather obviously, the hotel's design is exquisite. Elegant, calm, modern clean lines, the space is both aesthetically beautiful while also very comfortable and functional. Something very special about the rooms - there are huge corner windows in every room due to the unusual shape of the original building. Our suite was generously sized (1200 sq feet is HUGE in a city like HK) and each of the three main rooms had a huge corner of windows, making a total of 6 walls of windows. It was truly spectacular. Plus the hi-tech aspect of the room makes it very comfortable, everything can be controlled either from an in room I-Pod system or a simple button control system by the bed. I can only remember one other time when I experienced this level of hi-tech ease, it was in a Tokyo hotel years ago and from memory the Upper House system is even more sophisticated and user friendly. Allergy/chemical sensitivty extra notes - Positive: they provided me with allergy free bedding which was great. The rooms have some carpeting but are mostly hardwood floors. It is immaculately clean and I could not notice residue of fragrance or chemicals in the linens or in the rooms or elsewhere on the property except Level 6 - discussed below. Minor Negative: There is no chemical residue or fragrance anywhere except in the level 6 area where you can sit and have tea inside or go out into the "secret garden" and lawn area. This interior space where you must walk through to get to the elevator to reach your room each time has some heavily fragranced candles burning.
