This is unfortunate but at least it is the only space in the hotel where they seem to burn scent or if they do burn candles elsewhere then it is the only place where the scent gathers to a degree that I notice it and it makes me headachey as I pass through. Every other common space seems to be scented candle free. Perhaps they could burn 100% essential oils instead of chemically perfumed candles? Then there would be a therapeutic aspect to the scent and almost no-one would have an adverse reaction, generally even the most sensitized immune systems and allergies can handle essential oil scents. The location is great, quiet/calm yet still very convenient. Public transportation is close by, or take short cab rides anywhere you might need to go in Central. The hotel is walking distance to all random conveniences and services you might need in Wan Chai (VIM pilates studio, Murray River Wine shop, next door to the wine shop a great inexpensive laundry service, on the same street a small health food/organics store, other small stores with fresh fruit & vegetable juices). The restaurant is very good. I ate 1 lunch there, 1 dinner with friends and we always enjoyed the room service hot breakfast. There is high tea but I did not have it. This was our honey moon and the Upper House did EVERYTHING possible to make it a memorable and comfortable stay. We received a complimentary upgrade to a spectacular suite and it really made our trip. The actual suite was huge and gorgeous but also the generosity and thoughtfulness of the upgrade also made it special. Every level of management and staff seemed like the were always taking that extra step to make sure you have everything you need - we spent in total 7 nights at the hotel on 3 occasions, coming in and out of HK as we made side trips to other places in Asia and every time we checked back in to the hotel from being away they had earl grey tea waiting for me (with soymilk on the side) with either cookies or chocolate covered strawberries. Our bags which we had left behind were already in the room waiting for us and the allergy free bedding was already on the bed. That level of efficiency and thoughtfulness really made an impression on me and the Upper House stands out as my best hotel experience not only of this trip but of any hotel ever. I have stayed at various Amans (all gorgeous and fantastic in their own way) and numerous other excellent hotels, but the Upper House has managed to make such a strong impression on both my husband and myself for the extra small details - they just get it right!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience at Upper House”
Reviews.Author: Kate133
Reviews.Content: Fabulous ending to three-week SE Asia vacation. Location adjacent to Pacific Place. Within metro or walking distance to Central (tram to peak, walk-way to restaurant/club area). Excellent service. Nice bar/restaurant. Great ammenities and view.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: tiankyv
Reviews.Content: i have seen many many hotels as i have worked in this industry.. for HK standard, this hotel is very close to perfect. I loved every day of my stay in Upper House! it is totally worth it! location was excellent as it was near the MTR, fantastic shopping just 30seconds away! breakfast in this hotel is very very good! every item was fresh, the jam is homemade..amazing! service was very good as well.. especially the restaurant staff! rooms were gorgeous and thoughtfully designed. Loved the snacks and drinks given in the room! the only minus points are the toilet paper could have been a better quality type.. the towels can be of a more luxurious type too. Other than that.. it is a close to perfect hotel. Well done especially for a boutique non chain hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: forgotton
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for the first time over the New Year. The management and team provided a fantastic personalised stay. Having been fortunate enough to travel significantly, and being a graduate of the hotel school at Cornell, it's not often I'm impressed, but I'm glad to say I was pleasantly so at Upper House. The staff are friendly, accommodating, and preemptive of guests' needs. The rooms are well furnished to a very high quality, and contain everything a guest could need. I very much enjoyed my stay and look forward to returning in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: colm1234
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights here. Fabulous comfort and service. It's not as cool as The opposite house in Beijing and seems to be aimed at the chic market. No pool. Small gym. I ate breakfast one morning otherwise did not use the facilities. The hotel lacks life because there is no interaction between the hotel and the street. No one wanders in and hangs out. But I have no hesitation recommending this beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: thdopeblog
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel had great service (no silly long check in or out) My room was large and the interior was very modern and was very comfortable (great Ren products in the bathroom). The restaurant was delicious with friendly staff. The location was not great but easyily accesible, will definitely stay here again. http://thedopeblog.blogspot.com

Reviews.Title: “The Bell's”
Reviews.Author: Swansonbell
Reviews.Content: We've lived in Hong Kong for 12 years and experienced many hotels here and overseas. We recently stayed at The Upper House for my husbands 50th birthday and wedding anniversary and were totally blown away by the whole weekend. This hotel does exactly what it says it does, it's your home away from home but in the highest luxury you often expect, but don't always receive from other places. The staff and service was the best we have come across and everything is done to perfection, quickly, efficiently, and often thought of before you even think of it yourself! The rooms and food are also exceptional with a maxi bar that provides most of the incidentals without charge. It's relatively expensive but if you are lucky enough to have a package room deal then it can be very good value. It totally meet all our needs. I would highly recommend it for business, couples, families (only if you are in Hong Kong to see sights) and anyone else who expects good service, food and lovely rooms in a hotel. It's an excellent location for doing all the things you want to do in HK. Note that it doesn't have a spa or swimming pool if that's your thing. Well done Upper House for being the first people to get it right and meeting all our expectations!

Reviews.Title: “NO FACILITIES, POOR SERVICE, NOT 5 STARS, OVERPRICED”
Reviews.Author: Yurgeneva
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel due to good reviews here on Trip Advisor and were very disappointed. First of all, this is not purpose-built hotel, it's a convertion of residential unts, therefore: no swimming pool, poor and tiny gym, no spa, no buffet breakfast, etc. The location is extremely unconvenient as it is far away from everything except Pacific Place shopping mall. The staff is extremely unhelpful: once I forgot my key in the room and they refused to let me in, explaining that they are not allowed to do it without verbal confirmation from my husband. Lady at the reception said she tried to contact him over the phone but failed. Therefore I had to take a taxi to another island to meet my husband and collect the keys. Guess what? Nobody called him, we checked his moble phone: no incoming calls, no missed calls. The concierge desk is equally helpless. Now the 2 good things about this hotel: rooms are OK and food is eatable (3 times overpriced, though).

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculously close to perfection”
Reviews.Author: TxTree
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights over new year's eve weekend and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The rooms are spacious and absolutely stunning - so well and thoughtfully designed, there is almost nothing you could do to improve on them (and that is saying a lot - I am quite particular!). Beds are super comfortable, lighting is lovely, bathrooms are exquisite, awesome amenities, changing room/closet area extremely well laid out. The views from our rooms were wonderful. And the complimentary offerings in the minibar were a great touch (especially for our kids). We really did not want to leave our room . . . . But we did and enjoyed beautiful breakfasts at Cafe Gray, with harbor views to match. (After two weeks in Asia, we were very pleased to have genuinely delicious western breakfasts!!) The fitness center was small but in my view was adequate for a boutique hotel. I went both mornings and was the only person there. Service was top-notch - the staff were friendly and very helpful in offering restaurant and sightseeing suggestions and organizing transportation. I received prompt responses to my email inquiries before we arrived. And the day we left, the hotel emailed to let us know that they had found an item we had left behind. I'd return in a heartbeat and would definitely recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, gym ... not so much”
Reviews.Author: CloseReachVancouver
Reviews.Content: Almost everything about this hotel is over the top. The rooms are amazing, the bed-and-breakfast option is the best (pick anything on the menu), the service is pleasant, and the lounge is funky. As two active guys, the only shortcoming my partner and I would note is that the gym is poor. For this calibre of hotel, they should do better on the fitness front.

Reviews.Title: “Deserving of 100% in all respects”
Reviews.Author: Violet_and_Jeff
Reviews.Content: Apart from being a very stylish hotel with amenities and facilities which are all first-class +++, the hotel's restaurant is absolutely superb. Add to all of that a wonderful, exceedingly friendly and helpful staff and you have a hotel which rates 100% in every respect.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Boutique, just about faultless”
Reviews.Author: Julian L
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Upper House for 5 nights. We were lucky enough to be in a suite with a harbour view. It has to be one of the sexiest, coolest hotel rooms in the world. Because of the architecture, every room had two glass walls overlooking Hong Kong harbour- the living room was spacious and well equipped, minibar, excluding wine was included in the price. In the bedroom, the bed was in the middle of the room and we kept the curtains open so that we could go to sleep with the view of HK at night and be woken to an incredible view in the morning, the bath was in the middle of the bathroom and again, one could relax with one of the most amazing modern views in the world. The room was incredibly well-equipped lacking nothing at all. The hotel is so discreet, no checkin, no busy lobby area to annoy guests who just want to hide away, but upstairs the bar was buzzing and the restaurant amazing (but very expensive). Full marks, best hotel in HK by miles. A very well run, well designed hotel and I will be back for more on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Style lacking substance”
Reviews.Author: AHuskyLondon
Reviews.Content: I admit i'm approaching my review of The Upper House from a critical angle, but as with any hotel at this price the details are what make the difference and expectations should be high. The hotel aspect is well finished, the design of the common areas is well executed and the use of materials and overall interior design is outstanding. The rooms are also nicely realised particularly the bathroom, although there was a slightly dated feel to the overuse of veneer. The main problems we experienced at the hotel were one major food issue that involved returning a dish as it was unsafe for consumption and another service related issue that was quite frustrating, both simply not what you would expect. So thumbs up for deisgn, its definiately one of the best put togther places we've stayed but the service and food was not really up to par, perhaps we we're just unlucky this time.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel experience that's remarkable!”
Reviews.Author: Robert C
Reviews.Content: First impressions are amazing, yet when the whole experience becomes indelible is remarkable. From the minute you arrive at main entrance, you are escorted directly to your room and provided that personal service in every team member's desire to maximize your experience with this hotel. From the fragrance that permeates throughout the entire hotel, the details of having your room made up while you are out for only an hour exercising during the early morning, to the friendliness and professionalism that every team member presents, makes your stay even more special. The ability to listen and provide that extra attention to detail surrounding a guest's stay are what will bring me back to enjoy the experience once more. There would not be a close alternative to this hotel in my opinion (certainly something I shared with friends). I look forward to my return to Hong Kong and staying in The Upper House.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: alibullock
Reviews.Content: So the good; - Great location in the heart of Hong Kong - The bar has one of the best views over Hong Kong's iconic harbour - Rooms are huge - Garen on the upper ground is private and a great spot The bad; - its a 6 star hotel and the price reflects that! (oh but so good) - Disclousure, I work for Cathay Pacific and I know some of the staff in the mkt team. But this does not affect my review.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: grouse47
Reviews.Content: The room is stunning. It is about as well appointed as any hotel room I have stayed at. The service is impeccable and all in all just a wonderful experience. I hope I have to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A bath with a view and one of the most beautiful bars in the world”
Reviews.Author: neilsonparc
Reviews.Content: ...what more could you ask for!? We stayed in a Studio 80 room, which was stylish and spacious enough - the corner sofa was a great place to sit on a rainy afternoon reading mags and watching the light on the skyscraper windows and the clouds on the mountains. I loved the bathroom - a large bath with a view, although I'm talking 'harbour glimpses' if you stood up and twisted around rather than a full-on harbour view, at least from our room. But it is the bar and restaurant that are the real drawcards here. Andre Fu has done a world-class job here - just stunning. The Upper House thoroughly deserves its Hot Pink rating on the neilsonparc Lust List.

Reviews.Title: “amazing rooms, great location but no wellness services”
Reviews.Author: jetssc
Reviews.Content: The rooms are truly exceptional, and so is the service. The location is excellent, both for business and pleasure. The restaurant is slightly disappointing, especially when compared with reviews and reputation. The only - but quite significant - downside, is the lack of wellness/sport facilities. There is no pool, no real gym, no spa... This is really a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and one of the best service I ever had”
Reviews.Author: Andrea44sg
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy my four day stay there. Great location, excellent service. It is rather expansive, but this place really makes you feel so welcome and they are so generous that it is all worth it. Staff are really helpful, print out map to give you direction, assist in carrying shopping. The room is great, great view, all drinks are free, including beer and some fancy health drink, accept wine. Free snacks, M & M, biscuits...... Toiletries (Ren) supply is generous, more than what you need, almost need not to bring any of your own, even provide face exfoliator and mask, nail polish wipes, eye cream,........... Outgoing location calls are complimentry. The breakfast is excellent, healthy, almost everything on the menu is healthy and organic. Great tasting. We had dinner in the resturant, it was great, good presentation, the taste was excellent. MTR is just about 10 min away.

Reviews.Title: “More than a harbour view ...”
Reviews.Author: SFR6262E
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Upper House some time last year and had a great experience. The rooms are huge, with the generous walk-in wardrobe area and the fantastic bathroom with a spectacular view of the Victoria Harbour. And the hotel management is kind enough to leave a little reminder at the window about privacy - since the bathroom has a floor to ceiling transparent glass facade. But there is a little detail which many may have missed out... Due to the 90 degree stepping-form of the building design and the fascinating physics of light reflection, one can actually see into the bathroom of the adjacent room by way of the reflection in the glass facade. This only happens at night, when the lights are on inside. Perhaps the management should post another warning to prevent further embarrassment. Aside from this, there is very little to complain about the Upper House. It definitely is one of the BEST hotels in Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Size Matters”
Reviews.Author: LQLuu
Reviews.Content: We landed at around 8pm and used their pickup service (Lexus RX Hybrid), the driver was polite and spoke adequate English. He offered us hot towels and bottled water, and kept up the small talk during the ride back to Central, which took about 25 minutes. Upon arrival at the small, but modern and efficient lobby, we were escorted up to our 850 sq-ft room by Edwin who was friendly and helpful. We were given an upgrade (no charge) to a room with both harbor and city views. We made reservation for a Studio 80 (850 sq ft) island view only. Edwin showed us the the space and helped us with buying SIM card for our cell phones and exchanging money for us. There was a plate of cookies waiting for us on the desk. The elegantly modern design with muted tones and attention to details throughout the room was even more amazing than what everyone has raved about on this site. Everything from, sofa, desk, wood paneling, in-room scultures, fine tiles and natural stone, lighting, the bathroom rain shower and tub, to the overall size of the room can not be describe by words alone. The Upper House truly belong in the upper echelon of luxury hotels for its design and for it's 5-starred service. At peak hours, it can be very difficult to hail a taxi (even with the help of the staff in front of the hotel), as most taxis are taken by customers of the much bigger JW Marriott next door to the Upper House. The Ipod in our room never worked properly even though it was replaced by the staff once, and the wood floor does tend to creak a lot as you're walking on it. If you opted not to buy the daily breakfast package (at Cafe Gray Deluxe), there are many other options in Pacific Place Mall downstairs or you can give Cafe Gray a try as we did one morning. The food is very good (fruit compote of mangoes and berries was excellent). Throughout our 5 days at this hotel, we were greeted everytime by everyone from housekeepers, drivers, clerks, bartenders, waitstaff with a warm smile and a greeting. I was particularly sensitive to the bad service habits of some Asian service providers towards other Asians customers, but I was pleasantly surprised that none of those old, outdated attitudes were found at this hotel. We were made to feel welcome and we were treated with respect and smiles.

Reviews.Title: “Stay there everytime when I need a hotel”
Reviews.Author: P_edmund
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last weekend for my birthday!was awesome!! First of all, its so warm that. They sent out a preference email. To personalise my room, Secondly, they have arranged a specific lady to greet me and boyfriend. To show us the room. Introduce everything in the room Thirdly, they never say no to us, no matter , we need more beers, stationary, they always say sure  Sooo willing to help Last be not least , it was my birthday . They have even prepared a birthday cake in the room while we were out. What an surprise . Thank you guys! Make a such experience for me =)

Reviews.Title: “This is my favorite hotel in the world!!!”
Reviews.Author: realfan68
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel on business about every other month. It is a converted residential project which sits on top of the J.W. Marriott. The rooms are what make this property work. They are magnificent and the bathrooms are huge. The views are spectacular as well. The hotel is located in Pacific Place right next to a large mall so there are plenty of dining options and you can go on a stroll if the mood fancies you. The service at this property is also always top notch. They have a modern check in procedure whereby you go right to your room and are checked in via in iPad application. I highly recommend staying at this property.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: blaine X
Reviews.Content: Views. Serice. Rooms. Fit Out. Amenities. All perfect. I would have to say that this was the BEST hotel we have ever stayed in. Dining at Grays upstairs or room service was perfect. We literally never wanted to leave our room. Great size. Amazing views. Big bath!

Reviews.Title: “The way hotels should be...!”
Reviews.Author: Im_a_travlin_fool
Reviews.Content: I've just spent four of the most enjoyable days in a hotel anywhere in the world at The Upper House in Hong Kong. For me, perfection in terms of a hotel product. Small hotel hospitality adds an entirely new experience to hotel travel, and if this is the Swire brand of hospitality, I hope there will be much more of it. This is a hotel that you do not so much stay in, as become a part of the experience. The space in the guest room is pleasantly neutral giving the feeling of floating in to the environment and existing within it, versus fitting in with the room. Bright, light, airy, floor to ceiling glass, oversized space, thoughtful comfort, unobtrusive design and decor. A guest room that you really have to find good reasons to leave, so pleasant is the existence inside the space. The overall property also demonstrates that you don't need an abundance of everything to make a memorable experience. The food and beverage offerings are limited by comparison to many hotels in terms of number of outlets, but in this case less is more based upon, again, the quality of the space as well as the fare on offer. The working desk and the bathrooms are a clear standout, although this is unkind on the rest of the room experience, which really leaves nothing to be desired from the quality of the bathroom amenities through to the supersoft bath robes. The single comment that I felt could deliver a real improvement for the business traveller; a matching business desk chair of the quality of the rest of the room. I daresay, then I would never leave. I didn't have the cause to interact with the staff of the property to a high degree, but the occasions when I did so were polite, professional and efficient, and with a genuine interest in the welfare or the experience of the guest. However, not needing much help from the team for me is also a compliment to the thought around the overall product. It's all at your finger tips. Congratulations, Marcel and the team. It's not easy to get the product and service mix so well balanced, and as such it deserves to be recognised. I'll be back. Many times! Onward to The Opposite House.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: NilsP
Reviews.Content: Firstly, a special thanks to Benny (Guest Experience) and Marcel (Hotel Manager) for making this stay the very best in any hotel I've stayed in. The Upper Suite offers amazing views, an apartment sized hotel room, REN toiletries, rain showers, bath tub with a view, loud speakings in the bathroom, lots of wardrobe space, huge bedroom with a LCD tv and a large bed, a fantastic entertainment system in the lounge with a LCD tv, lots of seating areas, a dining table, espresso machine with a selection of coffee and tea, and a 'maxi bar' - featuring all the goodies you could think off from choc's to biscuits and from soft drinks to booze! One minor complaint - having paid a lot of money for the room at a hotel with no leisure facilities apart from a gym I was shocked that the hotel could not offer complimentary guest passes to nearby leisure facilities at the neighboring Conrad and Marriott. This hotel has proved to me it does not forget its guests once they have checked out by firstly emailing the onward hotel about me and even emailing me after a month a happy birthday email! Well done to everyone at the Upper House HK - see you soon again (if not needing a spa like facilities)!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Luxury home”
Reviews.Author: Denise C
Reviews.Content: 2 of my friends booked the "Upper Suite" room at this hotel and they both highly recommended it. So, we picked this hotel for our first night after our wedding. It is like a modern luxury home. The design make you feel like home. The suite have spacious living room, bathroom, and bedroom with extraordinary city view of Hong Kong. Service was great. It is definitely a 5-star! I didn't bring my makeup remover and the staff arranged to buy me one at 2:00am in the morning. Location is perfect! I think it is one of the best hotel in the world!

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Honk Kong !”
Reviews.Author: MaryanneTea
Reviews.Content: This is an oasis in a crazy and wonderful part of the world, you whiz and whirl around Hong Kong all day and get back to a brilliantly designed environment that i just did not want to leave. The rooms are truly exquisite in every possible way and the staff are brilliant !! Upper House is a 15 out of 10 for me i have stayed at some of the best hotels in the world and this is one of my favourites particularly for business, it all just works ..beautifully ! Enjoy..

Reviews.Title: “Yet Another 5-star Vote”
Reviews.Author: Beachbilly
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the other gushing reviews. Rooms are super hip. We dream about the shower. The bed delivers a great night's sleep. Staff is a 10. Attention to detail is off the map. Tips: (1) have a dinner at the restaurant...really deserves the Michelin star; (2) rooms are so nice, you should make sure to buy tax-free liquor so you can enjoy cocktails in the room..especially if you have a harbor view...although maxi bar is quite a good deal also; (3) breakfast is great; (4) gym is well above average for a boutique hotel in asia; (5) consider paying for the harbor view. We can't imagine having a better experience at the Peninsular, the Mandarin or the Four Seasons. We won't consider any other hotel for out next Hong Kong visit. [As usual, Amex platinum card reservation through Leading Hotels worth all the perks.] Ranks with the very best hotel we have stayed at (and we have stayed at some of the best in the world).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, excellent features”
Reviews.Author: Jamie R
Reviews.Content: This new concept hotel from Swire group really is special. Hong Kong spoils visitors for choice, however Upper House really does tick most of the boxes! The studios are spacious, beds are oversized and comfy. Toiletries by Ren and a toilet bag filled with goodies are just some of the features in the stunning rooms. The maxi bar concept is great, free soft drinks and beer, free snacks and goodies! The real feature of each room is the 400sqf bathroom. Stunning open views across either the peak or Victoria harbour.... Bathe and watch the world go by... Or bathe and watch tv with the in bathroom tv. The only disappointment I have with the UH is there upmarket restaurant Cafe Gray. I think it's over hyped and the food and service can be disappointing. All in all a cool place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Live up to my expectation!”
Reviews.Author: UpperGuest
Reviews.Content: The Upper House is always my 1st choice hotel when I visit Hong Kong. I always get the full attention and hospitality from the management and guest service team. Great service, location and worth the stay! Dr Chow

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Cavan364
Reviews.Content: We finished our honeymoon here and it was the perfect end to it. The hotel was fabulous. The rooms had every detail covered and the views from the room and the bathroom was superb. The restaurant and bar have great food and drinks along with a happening scene. And the staff was amazing! We loved this hotel and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional botique hotel in the heart of HK.”
Reviews.Author: Alsq
Reviews.Content: A bit difficult to find at first. Just look for the Marriott at Pacific Place and it is a few steps away. We were greeted in the entrance (not exactly a usual hotel lobby as it is just a counter) and accompanied to our room/suite. The view from the room AND the bath is great. The tub is separate from the shower which is a plus. Very well designed! Loved the FREE mini bar and the Illy Coffee Machine in the room. My favorite in the breakfast menu was the eggs Benedict. Check out their website for more info.

Reviews.Title: “Superb city hotel”
Reviews.Author: lfriviere
Reviews.Content: We were are extremely happy with our stay at the Upper House, it is certainly one of the best city hotels we have ever stayed in. Usually we can't wait to get home but for the first time ever we didn't want to leave. The attention to detail is meticulous and the staff are very welcoming and happy to go the extra mile to make your stay even more enjoyable. We were also very impressed with Cafe Gray for breakfasts and dinner, the bar has a great buzz about it as well. Finally we have to say the decor is very special, the designer Andre Fu has done a fabulous job at understated luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Detail-oriented perfection”
Reviews.Author: joshdotcom
Reviews.Content: There are a handful of hotels in the world that get almost every detail absolutely perfect - and it is an especially good day for me when I am blessed with finding another example to add to my list in the Upper House. As soon as you arrive you are greeted immediately even before you approach the front desk by a staff member ready to take you straight to your room. Credit cards are handed over inside your room and are swiped via iPad. An iPod Touch is provided to you to order room service on if you like or to explore the hotel. Every item in the room screams luxury, from the ample high-end products in the bathroom, to the furniture, rain shower head, deep bathtub, ample closet space, multiple lighting options, and electronic curtains. And if that's not enough there are snacks, bottled water, coffee, beer and internet which are provided free of charge. While the Intercontinental hotel in Kowloon still has the best views of Hong Kong, everything that you wish the Intercontinental was when you pay far more to stay there is at the Upper House. While the hotel is far from cheap, Hong Kong hotels are an expensive lot. Not to mention that the experience of staying in a hotel of this caliber is certainly worth the price - especially for true hotel connoisseurs. My only gripe, and its a small one, is that there is a free coffee bar in the lobby that will make you a drink of your choice upon request - but the catch is you're not allowed to bring the drink to your room - rather, you have to drink it in the narrow lobby or go outside on the terrace - that seemed unnecessary to me. Its a small gripe considering there is an espresso machine in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: ExpatJetsetter
Reviews.Content: Outstanding intuitive service from the point of reservation to the departure, a hotel that clearly stands out from the rest of the crowd. Loved the attention to detail, impressive (and obviously thought out) amenities, in room technology that actually works – refreshing! The Upper House is the only place to stay in Hong Kong. I wish I could move in full time!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RoboColorado
Reviews.Content: We loved the Upper House. The room was gorgeous and the views expansive. Staff couldn't do enough and came immediately if there was a question about operating espresso machine or TV remote. The bar is a happening place in HK, with views to die for. Breakfast was delicious and the restaurant is very attractive. I would encourage anyone visiting HK to stay at the Upper House.

Reviews.Title: “Heard The Upper House was something different and they do absolutely lift the bar.”
Reviews.Author: moneyticketpassport
Reviews.Content: The team at The Upper House provide exceptional service that is in support of a beautiful property. They helped us prior to our arrival with various holiday arrangements and during our week stay showed service is not a lost art.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ShellSydney
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a Business/Holiday dream. After exhausting days of meetings, travelling in and out of Hong Kong, the Upper House is a lovely base to return. Having now stayed in this Hotel over 6 times I can say that the staff truely know you and are always helpful. The welcome, to check out is without fault. Breakfast is relaxing and staff are attentive. The bed, bathroom and bath products are warm and spa like. Extremely quiet Hotel. Next to the Hotel is Central Plaza with all the shops, restaurants and rail. This is a nice Hotel to return to after a busy busy day in Hong Kong. Heading back in October, looking forward to as always. (fill that bath and bake those cookies Upper House)

Reviews.Title: “The best way to end our 4 week trip”
Reviews.Author: SamrNZ
Reviews.Content: We ended our 4 week travel around Europe with a one night stay at The Upper House and it was a the perfect way to end a massive and slightly exhausting trip. We only wish we could have spent more time there! Very spacious and we had the lowest end room. Bathroom was amazing with a beautiful bath with great views. Their maxi bar is a great idea - you get free water, beer, soft drink and snacks. Other hotels could definitely learn from this, as well as the free wifi which was reasonably fast. The concierge was very helpful when looking for a place to have dinner but we ended up in the hotel's 1 Michelin starred restaurant - which was wonderful (I'll review this separately). It's definitely one of the best rooms we've ever stayed in and if they had a pool and spa then it would have been one of the best hotels. (There are other hotels close and I think you can get access to their pool - maybe for a cost.) We're already thinking about when we can come back to Hong Kong just so we can stay at The Upper House! Would highly highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “They think of everything!”
Reviews.Author: take-your-time
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly amazing. Their personalized service is unbelievable. We advised them we were arriving in HK early after an overnight flight and not only was our room ready, they had upgraded us! Benny, the guest services manager who showed us to our room was brilliant. He found out what we liked and advised us of a fabulous exhibition of works in town. When we came back to the room after dinner in the evening he sent up a treat - hot milk and homemade cookies and a book of the exhibition with a lovely card. What thoughtful service! This hotel has set new standards of service for all of Asia. And the room! Well it's as wonderful as everyone says. We have (we are still here, just couldn't wait to review it) a view of the harbor and the green hills behind and a bit of city too. The bed is heavenly. The 'maxi-bar' is a great idea. Never having to count how many beers or waters you have had is wonderful and it has an illy expresso machine that makes great coffee. The bathroom is amazing. The rain shower is the best I've had in any hotel and it is the cleanest bathroom of any hotel I've stayed in. The bath is gorgeous with a view and a pillow for relaxing. There is also a TV in the bathroom if you ever get sick of the gorgeous view. Full sized Ren toiletries, an amenity kit that contains eye gel, night cream, body cream, face mask, everything you could possibly need as well as designer toothbrushes etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: sting800
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel my last few trips to HK and have truly enjoyed every stay. From the amazing, huge-for-HK bathrooms with some of the best views in town to the free minibar and snacks, the whole experience is above and beyond the typical hotel experience. Location is perfect, right on top of Pacific Place on top of the Admiralty MTR station. The views from Cafe Grey on the top are amazing although the food isn't all that great relative to what's on offer in the rest of HK. My #1 choice for a hotel in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best Hotel experience I have ever had.”
Reviews.Author: RobbieQSnake
Reviews.Content: Almost by chance I arranged to stay at the Upper House on my first Hong Kong trip a week ago. Every aspect of my stay was excellent from beginning to end. Dean Winter and his team place an emphasis on personal service which is in my experience unique, the like of which I have not seen anywhere else in the world. I will always return to the Upper House when the opportunity presents itself.

Reviews.Title: “In a Class of its own”
Reviews.Author: Michael L
Reviews.Content: I am fortunate to have stayed at some of the best hotels in the World. This one tops the lot. The interior design is contemporary, elegant and pristine, with spectacular views throughout. But the real miracle of the Upper House is the incredible ability of every member of staff to make every guest feel they are the only one in the hotel. This is seriously impressive management in action...a highly professional team from top to bottom dedicated to service excellence, but with a "family feel" I've never before experienced in a 5 Star hotel. Breathtakingly impressive. This hotel soothed a hectic few days on an exploratory visit to assess business acquisition opportunities in Asia - incredibly, the excellence we saw at this hotel has become a factor in my colleague's and my conclusions that Hong Kong is a place we want to do business in!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: coolio
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in some very nice 5 star hotels but this was another level. Prior to arrival we had a number of questions for the hotel, had them receive some items ahead of our stay and they always responded within the hour and always very very efficient. We had other non hotel related issues throughout the trip and the hotel were impeccable in assisting us. For anyone taking the airport express train a taxi from HK station will be your best bet and will cost about $5HKD. However, we were happy to take the scenic route and caught the train then airport shuttle bus and get off at JW Marriott. The hotel entrances are 20m apart. Welcomed upon arrival and bags were taken to the room by one gentleman while another showed us around. We had an upper suite and I have seen some views but this was breathtaking. Absolutely breathtaking. He wanted to show us around but I just wanted to stop and stare. He must've heard 'wow' a million times. There was remote control curtains and sheers in the lounge and bedroom. Remote control blinds in the bathroom. In boxes like the tv remotes. Lighting buttons by each side of the bed. Very good free wifi access throughout the hotel. Free minibar (sans wine and champagne). The bottles of water came in very handy. They also had energy drinks, sparkling water, etc. Lots and lots of toiletries, things like bath oil, bath salts, a 15+ item full toiletries bag. The bed was heavenly. I get a bad back but it was perfect, it just ate me up. The room also had a yoga mat, umbrella, the best wardrobe space I've seen with soft closure drawers. The aircon worked perfectly and no noise. It was a touch entry system into the room and if you had your 'do not disturb' sign on it glowed through the wood outside the door. Housekeeping were very efficient. I would go on about the bathroom but the photos are everywhere for everyone to see. It is THAT good. The design and layout is genius. A double seating area and plug sockets in the drawer is just perfect for straighteners, hairdryers etc. In fact, the number of sockets throughout the suite was impressive. 2 x 2 bathrobes - one velour and one summer style. My partner had a quick look at the gym and it wasn't huge but was nicely spaced in different rooms and with water, cereal bars, etc. We didn't use it as we didn't have time. Breakfast at the top of the hotel was great. Everyone was so polite and from our second morning up there we were greeted by our name. We tried the pastries, cooked breakfast, fruit, pancakes, waffles, during our stay and all wonderful. Coffee was great too. We regret not having the Chinese breakfast though. The hotel was in a great location for the mtr, trams, the peak, Hong Kong park, pacific place mall. A lot of people say the MO has a better service level but I cannot imagine it being better than this. Every single member of staff we passed greeted us and they went well and truly above what I would expect or have had before. The best hotel I've stayed in and would go back tomorrow in a heartbeat. My only concern is nothing will ever live upto this standard. We have since stayed in some great great suites but the Upper House had the wow factor and would make any trip to Hong Kong unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong luxury. I won't stay anywhere else again”
Reviews.Author: MamaBear2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Upper House for a weekend away in Hong Kong. I'd read great a great review and really wanted to spoil my husband and I. We booked a harbour view room and it really lived up to our expectations. The room featured floor to ceiling windows which provided a fabulous view of the Harbour. The bed was super comfortable - soft bedding, plus pillows. Wonderful bath with super comfy cushion Great sized room (especially for Hong Kong!) and the maxi bar was a great touch. We enjoyed breakfast at Cafe Gray which was beautifully presented. The coffees were perfectly made. Loved the Ren toiletries which were restocked during our two night stay. The Upper House is expensive. But it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Modern Rooms and Amenties at Upper House”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkie33
Reviews.Content: The Upper House is one of the most beautiful hotels I've ever stayed. The staff were very knowledgeable and went out of their way to be helpful...one thoughtful touch included a staff member bringing me some reading materials on the "lawn" after I had checked out and was waiting for my airport transfer. "D" and Derrick were both wonderful; the former was very courteous and helped familiarize me with the hotel and the area around the hotel, and Derrick was kind enough to assist me with my bags as I went to the hotel next door for Airport Express transfer. The hotel is completely paperless (so refreshing!) and very modern in design and character. Every detail is considered...even the lovely signature scent of the hotel lobby and common areas. Room decor is stunning and very chic...bed was extremely luxurious from the mattress comfort to the linens. As others have noted, there is a "free" minibar inclusive of snacks, which is a pleasant treat when you compare to other high-end hotels with mini-bar prices to match. I look forward to planning another trip to Hong Kong just so I can stay at the Upper House again!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at its very best”
Reviews.Author: rustycycle
Reviews.Content: The Upper House hotel is everything previous reviewers have stated. It is pure luxury with great service from great staff. Depending upon your reason for visiting HK, its location could either be good or bad. Its primarily a business hotel located on top of the JW Marriot hotel, however with its own small entrance and foyer next door. Located in Pacific Place it is some distance from either the subway or the ferries. Local shopping is also some distance away, however for those who want desinger shops, the Pacific Plaza is opposite with every possible top level store represented there as well as some excellent eating places. Being small also means that it is quiet, however we found the Cafe Gray on the 49th floor full of business types and very noisy, making a quiet drink or meal out of the question. The rooms are large for HK standards and contain all the mod cons that you would expect. Very comfy bed and complimentary mini bar were highlights. A full length bath with views out over the harbour was a delight. My only gripe was that there was no buffet breakfast, but rather an expensive a la carte service which also makes for a longer wait if you are in a hurry. This hotel has set a new standard for 5 star hotels and many other so called 5 star properties must now be rated as 4 star. Very well recommended, we enjoyed our stay totally.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway”
Reviews.Author: SuperOFW
Reviews.Content: Attentive service, great suite. The lawn was a good place to have a pre-dinner drink away from the crowds of Cafe Grey

Reviews.Title: “What a cool and contemporary hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Susanloo
Reviews.Content: Renovated 2 years ago from an apartment complex this ultra modern property is a cut above the rest. I felt more like I was in an apartment than a hotel. Every mod con at the touch of a button and more. Personal attention from one contact made sure our every need was met. Right next to the Pacific Place shopping complex. What a shame we only had one night. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, amongst the best I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: OandO-AMS
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, spacious and comfortable rooms, great location, awesome design and very nice restaurant. Everything you expect from a 5 star hotel. Truly a great experience and I will definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Bliss!”
Reviews.Author: Suzan S
Reviews.Content: The Upper House is simply superb in every way. A warm greeting by name on arrival, and we were taken up to our room for an easy I-pad check in. Not only was the room incredible, but also the staff seemed to anticipate our every need in advance. Hats off to the Upper House staff- you are all excellent. The room was impeccable with a large and outrageously comfortable bed, and a large and outrageously impressive bathroom, three huge sofas, an I-pod loaded with music linked to the AV system, and a well-chosen selection of coffee table books- design, fashion and the history of Hong Kong. Forget the minibar- here we had a maxi bar, a fridge full of complimentary drinks (loved the Firefly), an Illy Espresso machine, and jars of cookies, m&m’s, almonds and more. We were also delighted to find full sized “Ren” products in the bathroom. A few drops of the Ren rose oil in the bathtub whilst looking down on Hong Kong twinkling below me- pure heaven. The Upper House is well located within Pacific Place- good shopping and transport, but because we were so comfortable, we deferred and deferred leaving our room reading and playing backgammon instead… We did make it upstairs to Café Gray Deluxe; we had excellent food and wine, and then a drink at the long bar- great views, a great evening! I would not hesitate for a moment to recommend the Upper House to everyone; I am looking back on a stay at an exceptional and wonderful hotel. I really hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “A high class modern hotel with staff who attend to your every need.”
Reviews.Author: cpctraveller
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay, and we were not disappointed. We had a suite which comprised of a large sitting room, bedroom and bathroom. Also a separate toilet and separate wardrobe area. An amazing design and great view of the city and Harbour. Service was of the highest standard and the team worked hard to ensure that our stay was as enjoyable as it could be. We ate at the hotels Cafe Grey which was also of the higheat standard.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is pure luxury”
Reviews.Author: Chiaowers
Reviews.Content: This is definitely one of the best hotels I've ever stayed. I was picked up at the airport by a huge limo and as soon as I arrived in the hotel, people are waiting at the front door to greet me. They then walked me to my room and checked me in in my room using the iPad. My room was over 800sqf, which was HUGE for HK, where real estate is the most expensive in the world. There is no mini bar in my room; instead, there is a Maxi bar where you can get all the M&Ms and cookies, and pops, and beers for free. (too bad champagne and wines weren't!) My room was on the 40 something floor and the view to the Victoria harbor was spectacular. One morning I even saw the eagle flying right outside of my window! The bar and the restaurant in the hotel were great too! Amazing breakfast and great service! The only drawback - there is no swimming pool and most of my taxi drivers didn't know where it is, even though it's in the middle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Honestly...by far the best hotel I have stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: TAYG
Reviews.Content: Not only the simplicty and elegance of its decoration take you to a serene journey after messy humid Hong Kong chaos, but the service is among the best you could get. The staff is extremely attentive and the room is full of complimentary goods (ex: ipod touch). Moreover room sizes are Huuge and I'm not even gonna mention how incredible bathrooms are.... Even if you allready planned on staying elsevere, I deeply recommend the Cafe Gray at 49th floor. A HK must!!

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love this place!”
Reviews.Author: ShopTraveller
Reviews.Content: My review is long overdue - I stayed at UH almost monthly over a period of 9 months during my trips to Hong Kong before having now permanently moved here. My one big regret having moved to HK is now, not being able to justify checking in as a guest! Love the luxuriously spacious bathrooms which are indulgently the same size as the bedroom!! Love the soft bathrobes!! Love the clean design lines!! The most unique feature of UH I feel is the team - from the moment you're greeted at the entrance to when you're immediately whisked up to your room and checked in virtually I always immediately feel like I am 'home' and having been a long-time avid traveller for business/ pleasure this was/ is a winning feature for me! This was one hotel where I did not mind staying indoors in my room all day - despite it being in such a vibrant city as Hong Kong! Despite not being a room guest now, Cafe Gray continues to be my frequent and favourite haunt - not only for the impeccable food and cocktails (and of course the view!) and unique blend of casual, hip and sophisticated atmosphere - but again because of the amazing team at Cafe Gray! I feel it is the team at the Upper House (and Cafe Gray) which makes this establishment such a great place to visit whether as a staying guest or just for food and drinks!

Reviews.Title: “Nobody does it better....”
Reviews.Author: IainJ2010
Reviews.Content: A Black Mercedes pulls up to the subtle, ultra modern hotel entrance. The VIPs are greeted by name on arrival and taken to their suite at the top of the Hong Kong skyscraper, panoramic views of the harbour surround them as the hostess checks them in on a hand held tablet PC. You would be forgiven for believing that this is the opening scene to a James Bond Movie as this is exactly how I felt as we were met by the immaculate staff at the Upper House. I booked the Upper House during a stopover on the way to Australia for our honeymoon and I wanted to try something else rather than the Four Seasons, Mandarin Oriental and the Peninsula. Our preference is for modern boutique hotels and the Upper House is the epitome of this genre. As you will notice from the date of our visit, (a year ago), this review has been submitted time late. This has allowed me to stay in several hotels in various locations world wide since our stay at the Upper House and I can report that it is still head and shoulders above anywhere I have stayed to date. The suite features an Audio Visual System that allowed me to stream music through the internet to every part of the suite, an ipod touch featuring local information and the ever popular Espresso Machine and MaxiBar (free sweets and chocolates). The hotel is in a central location on Hong Kong Island, allowing us to easily make our way to the major attractions and destinations of the city by MTR and Taxi and the tower is also attached to a high end shopping mall if that is your diversion of choice. Waking up in the morning, opening the electronic blinds at the touch of a button and having an espresso watching the city of Hong Kong come to life below you is a memory that will stay with me forever. There are many more details to our stay such as the cookies and warm milk brought to our room shortly after arrival, the complimentary toiletry bag, the extra luggage holdall, the glossy coffee table books about the history of Hong Kong..... these are just a few. The entire experience was sublime and made us feel like the most important people in Hong Kong. My sincere thanks go out to the talented and charismatic staff at the Upper House and congratulations go to the management who have created a hotel experience like no other. If you are looking for that extra level of quality that a large chain cannot provide, you will find it here at the Upper House in Hong Kong........

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING ...”
Reviews.Author: Mel S
Reviews.Content: Wow. We decided to splurge in HK and shared a room (as this was the only was we could afford it) ... but boy was it worth it. Great staff. Amazing room. Comfortable. Beautifully designed (i want the designer to design my London pad). And fab top floor bar and Grey's dining - delicous. Look fwd to returning. Thank you to the team and management. Trip Advisor reviewers got this one right.

Reviews.Title: “A great option in the heart of Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: traceller
Reviews.Content: I have tried this hotel shortly after they opened. Once you are past the escalator tha takes you from street level to the main lobby of the hotel you are in a stylish little boutique hotel.nice views and very laid out and comfortable rooms. Located in Pacific Place, this is A great location for both business and leisure travelers. I had a thoroughly enjoyabe stay. I' d give it a five if not for the escalator!

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could move in!”
Reviews.Author: PGilchrist
Reviews.Content: This set a new standard for hotels for me. The staff were friendly, helpful, and always available. The service was everything you could want, I even got a birthday cake from them. The bathroom you could live in, from the tub with the view of the city, to the wonderful rain shower. There is a maxi-bar in the room which is free (except wine), water, beer, soda, and snacks always available. The bar also has the best coffee maker anywhere. The room was immaculate, very very clean. Location was great, right on Pacific Place, easy access to the MTR and ferrys. They suggested several restaurants over our stay and all were excellent. The top floor has the bar and the restaurant, while not cheap they had excellent drinks excellent views, and good food. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Sim012
Reviews.Content: Everything about this boutique hotel is superb. The staff could not be more helpful. Rooms and bathroom great, fridge well stocked and apart from wine ,no charge. Jars of small packets of chocolate, nuts etc all available at no charge. Very prompt and efficient cleaning of room. Cafe Gray upstairs fabulous for breakfast and dinner, superb views.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: wilsom_sydney
Reviews.Content: No words can describe this hotel. Best hotel out there by far (altthough a bit expensive - but worth theoccasional splurge). And Greys restaraunt & bar on the top floor .... amazing views and great food.

Reviews.Title: “Good but misses the detail to bring it to very good”
Reviews.Author: Fryit
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights as a weekend break. The view from every room is exceptional. But it misses the beat on details....For example the bathroom has a television for you to watch when in the bath....But you cannot see it from the bath as the plug adjuster dictates that you lie another way!. The toilet are is also badly designed. There is a feeling of style over content. For a hotel that prides itself on its design it is nearly irritating to see them make such basic design faults. The staff , however, are faultless and extremely helpful and knowledgeable. It suffers from the same problems as its sister hotel in Beijing - trying too hard to impress and not enough thought on how people will actually use the space- ( How do you actually lie comfortably in a square bath) SWIRE would do well to realise that the impact wears off - the details remain.

Reviews.Title: “Still my favourite hotel in the world but must keep up service”
Reviews.Author: MvdK01
Reviews.Content: Excelent hotel, beautiful rooms, all there. Might miss a proper swimmingpool for some. Stayed there again this month twice and was a but surprised on the service during my 2nd stay in the same month. Usually concierge contacts you prior to arrival, this time not. So no fresh juice etc like I usually get. Next also it seemed nobody was really keen to bring the luggage to my room, so I took it myself. This hotel is known to me for their personal service but last stay it was not there. Too bad!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, we would definitely recommend it.”
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week in Hong Kong staying at the Upper House. We love staying at Luxe hotels and this hotel does not disappoint. The service was excellent, staff were very willing to help with any enquiries we had. The hotel rooms are very spacious and well appointed. We love the complimentary stocked mini bar and coffee machine . Free wifi was available in the rooms and the hotel car. The rooms are contemporary luxe and the bathroom in our harbor view room overlooked Hong Kong harbour . Lovely to soak in the bath with a view of hong kong ! We would definitely return when visiting hk again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: GV5_UK
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in The Upper House 3 times on different business trips, in different rooms and every stay is wonderful. They Seem to have got everything just right. A warm welcome everytime, but not too overfamiliar. Fast check in and striaght to your room. Speedy check out, excellent use of technology, in-room and for their back of house functions. It's the only place I stay in Hong Kong now.

Reviews.Title: “New, well designed hotel with no way to become a luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: Heilmann
Reviews.Content: Best: - Tastefully designed and new rooms - service which is really trying its best Appropriate: - Restaurant, bar Worst: - No spa - A claustrophobic gym - Try to find a concierge - No pool - Very unattentive reception, which is really no reception, at the entrence - Pricing at Four Seasons, Mandarin Oriental or Peninsula levels (new plus design does not equates to luxury)

Reviews.Title: “spectacular! stunning room & indulgent bathroom”
Reviews.Author: PrincessMaz
Reviews.Content: We indulged in a romantic night in our home city booking a harbour view room in Upper House. Absolutely fantastic room and a superbly indulgent bathroom which was the size of most normal hotel rooms by itself. Harbour view is terrific, the room was lush and extremely well appointed with iPad technology throughout including to order room service onscreen. Pre-loaded Ipod music was great and the bathtub for 2 with a great harbour view was a treat. Room service was superb and beautifully presented in jade ceramic "steamer baskets". Well worth the price tag for a night away from home in Hong Kong and exceeds the majority of 5star hotels I stay in every month for business travel in Asia.

Reviews.Title: “It does not get much better....”
Reviews.Author: awaywardtraveller
Reviews.Content: This certainly is the best hotel in Hong Kong. Yes, a bit expensive but really for the quality of stay, well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfection”
Reviews.Author: jason032286
Reviews.Content: This is my 5th time staying with The Upper House. I'm a world traveler and have been staying at most of the high-end boutique hotels world-wide. The Upper House definitely is one of my favorites. One word to describe is fantastic hotel would be "Home". My boyfriend and I were greeted by the friendly staff with warm and friendly smile as if we were back home. I love the stress-free check-in procedure with the general manager Paul Stanton personally taking us directly to our suite upon our arrival. It just gave that much more privacy and exclusivity. The room view of Hong Kong City and Harbor is breath-taking. Not only just the living room but also in the bedroom and bathroom. It is definitely the most spacious hotel room in Hong Kong with great "zen" taste in the decor - light wood walls, taupe-grey carpet, warm lighting. We love the little personal touches they provide for the amenities in the room. You get to have your very own person toiletry bags with a zip-lock plastic bag in it for further traveling. Also, the free mini bar that's restocked everyday with all the soft drinks, beers, high-end iced tea, almonds, M&M, and cookies. Always remember to empty them before the lady come in and restock them. The room-service is quite limited and expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room and fantastic breakfast”
Reviews.Author: hej23
Reviews.Content: The Upper House is a hidden get-away. Make sure to have some time in the spacious and lovely room. We got carried away by the view from the bath tub.

Reviews.Title: “Easily the best hotel in town”
Reviews.Author: alphalau
Reviews.Content: Large rooms. Simple, minimalist modern decor, yet warm tones are used. Large, heavenly bathrooms. Great views across the harbour or of the hills. Unobtrusive yet good service. Location excellent, right on top of Pacific Place. If I must fault it, it is the lack of comprehensive room service (choices a bit limited).

Reviews.Title: “fantastic experience in a beautiful, understated hotel”
Reviews.Author: bongomoppet
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautifully designed...very simple, but elegant. Service was great...inobtrusive, but there when you needed it. Location is great...just walk out the door to Pacific Place and you're steps away from the underground rail, which takes you just about anywhere in a few minutes. The room was large by any city standards and very comfortable. The maxi bar and cool amenities bag were the little extras that made good into great. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: xiaochi
Reviews.Content: Beautiful contemporary interiors, stunning harbour views. Too bad the service is cold and un-attentive. Both on check in and check out, staff stood inside the doors and did nothing to help with our luggage. Rooms are expensive, but once you are there everything is included (internet, mini-bar, we also had breakfast). Location could be good (if you like shopping in malls), but if you want to be in the heart of the business district this is not it. We actually found it a bit annoying as it is a bit too far to walk, and for a short cab ride we had to wait in long taxi lines.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent thru and thru”
Reviews.Author: AlexD63
Reviews.Content: Ill keep this one short.......The hotel was new clean sharp and with great attention to detail: absolutely excellent. I even got a free upgrade to a suite, which sadly was wasted as i was alone and not with my wife. The only downside was that the hotel being quite new and poorly sign posted was difficult for the taxis to find. I have stayed in many many 5 star hotels around the world and the rooms here were up there. Well done !

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Sue_and_Paul_10
Reviews.Content: Having read many reviews we selected the Upper House for a 4 night stay to celebrate our silver wedding anniversary and we were certainly not disapointed. Excellent location some 50 metres from the entrance to the Pacific Place shopping mall and a short walk through the park to the Peak tram. The entrance is understated and at first glance it could be mistaken as the garage to the adjoining Marriott. Spacious modern rooms with every possible amienety. Large bath / shower area with R E N toiletries supplied. The Michelin 1 star restaurant is located on the 49th floor and has views over the harbour which when enjoying dinner includes the daily 8pm light show. Good selection of well presented delicious food. All the staff were very polite and friendly with those at breakfast in particular going out of their way to make us feel at home and we felt they regarded us as friends rather than customers. A nice touch was the unexpected delivery of champagne and strawberries to our room on our anniversary. If you are looking for a modern hotel in a convenient location providing lovely rooms and quality dining then this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Blown away experience”
Reviews.Author: sol500
Reviews.Content: The Upper House was again an amazing experience even though it is becoming quite popular now. The hotel bar is buzzing with locals and expats, even so much so that it is now locally known as the 'expat swinger bar'. Service is impeccable, the staff go out of their way to make each persons stay 'that little bit special'. Even Mr or Mrs Average is treated like minor royalty, even though celebs now have started invading the place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: UkDel
Reviews.Content: The Upper House has thought about all the little details to make the experience of staying here very luxurious. With Ren toiletries an itouch to order room service and all the latest technology in the rooms including free wi fi there is little they haven't considered. Breakfast was included and was delicious with linen napkins and table service from an a la carte menu. Great location and views of the city you couldn't find a nicer place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JonSebastian
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. We had a suite on 46 floor facing the harbour. The rooms were spacious and with an amazing bathroom. The mini bar is free other than the wine and the snacks and coffee are free.! Superb service and a first class restaurant – Café Grey.

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: SirKimmi
Reviews.Content: I wasn’t sure if I should write any comment about the Upper House Hong Kong since I got very mixed feelings towards this hotel. This is my second time of staying over at the Upper House, and I have to say the problem I discovered during my first stay didn’t quite dissolve, but instead I found other problems that made me want to say something. First of all I don’t think I need to say anything about the décor and spacious size of the room. I know it is very rare to have such a huge room in Hong Kong, but since there are so many new hotels opening in China, I’m very spoiled with all these cool modernly designed hotels with giant rooms, which is why I wasn’t considering too much about the space they have is any special. And then it’s the breath-taking view that some of the guests loved. I think you often would find it very interesting just looking out of the windows if you don’t live in somewhere with such surroundings. But I live in Shanghai so this again isn’t anything new to me. Anyways, none of these is want I want to comment about. What I really want to say is that I don’t find this hotel very comfortable to stay with, especially the soft mattress that the centre part sinks down a little. I already felt it the first time and made a complaint to the hotel. They sent some staff and put a piece of supporting board underneath, but it didn’t help at all. I don’t have a back problem so lying on a softer bed won’t cause me any pain, but what about someone who does have back pain and also the older people? During my second visit it was the same situation again, and this time both my other friends who stayed with me together also felt the same way. Another unpleasant thing is the air-conditioning system. The three of us woke up a few times during the night either feeling cold or sweating. I must say this 24-hour-all-seasons-around-air-con-on situation is everywhere in Hong Kong. Everywhere we went the air-con was on cold even people on the streets are still wearing jackets and boots. I strongly suggest the Hong Kong government put up a regulation on air-condition usage like Mainland China did years ago that no public air-con system is allowed to go lower than 26c in summer. It’s definitely healthier and saves a lot of energy too. To be honest I can’t say the bad situations I encountered is the hotel’s fault, but rather is the investors’, who probably should have put in better quality beds. The hotel guest-experience manager later on called several times to apologize and sent us free fruit and lavender spray to help us sleep better. Perhaps they can tell the investors to buy some new mattresses? Another thing that bothered me a little is the breakfast menu with quite limited selections. The food wasn’t top quality either. It was really one of the few moments I said to myself that I wish I stayed in a different hotel. Despite all of the problems I met, I still feel that the staff there are genuinely trying to help their customers. This made their service quite memorable to me, but do I want to give up my good-night sleep? I don't think so.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anyplace else???”
Reviews.Author: Greenwich_CtLcp
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations and then some. The service was impeccable, the accomodations beyond anything we could have dreamt about. We have been fortunate to stay at some amazing places around the world - The Upper House ranks right up at the top.... Not a single complaint!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive? Yes. Habitable? Not really.”
Reviews.Author: dksenofi
Reviews.Content: Before I start my review, let me say that this could be my first time I'm staying in a boutique hotel; I usually stick to trusted chains or tried and tested independent ones. I was expecting quite a lot from this somewhat new hotel, as it has been recommended in a few travel magazines and won some interesting awards. So after staying some nights at Langham Place Mongkok, my partner and I crossed the harbour to The Upper House for a one night stay before flying home. Location: Not many people know where or what The Upper House is, even the locals. I get more than a few raised eyebrows when I tell my HK friends I'll be staying at The Upper House, so it was half expected that the taxi driver didn't know of this hotel either. Not a problem, since I asked him to take us to Pacific Place. He dropped us at the entrance to the mall on the 4th floor, there were no signage or large logos that tell you where the hotel is, so after asking around for a few minutes, was finally directed to the lobby. It was next to Marriott, but do look hard, even the entrance is somewhat obscure. Location of the hotel is ok - not terribly fantastic or exciting. However, I assume it will be good for business travellers, since it is located right in the middle of the business district, and one MTR station from Central. Below the hotel is Pacific Place shopping centre (not exactly below, but perhaps located in the same building but no direct access, you will have to get to the next building to get to the shopping centre - you get the idea), an upmarket mall which isn't all too different from IFC in Central, but much smaller. I'm not one who spends much on high end brands, so the shopping centre didn't interest me much. Around it however provide some different shopping options, but it will require a bit of a walk to get there. All in all, didn't think the location was anything to write home about - take the MTR to Causeway Bay if you want more options. Check in: When I stepped into the 'lobby', I approached one of the staff to tell him of the booking I had. Other staff around didn't appear to friendly, which is somewhat strange as I expected the service standards to be better. My check in staff was pleasant however, he escorted me to my room on the 38th floor and showed me around. The check in was finalised with the iPad. A quick tour around the room was provided - the staff was trying very enthusiastically to wow me with all the features etc, but all I wanted to do was to get some rest so I couldn't wait for him to leave. Not a problem again, I understand that some guests will need a little orientation given the features of the room and the hotel (not that there was many - more to come later). Room: When I stepped into the room, I wasn't wowed by it as I thought I would be. The ceiling was low, so it felt a little claustrophobic. The interiors were done tastefully, subdued colours and a lot of wood, it felt comfortable lounging around in the room. I have to add that the hotel was very huge, quite rare for HK hotels. They provided a semi-free mini bar, all snacks and drinks were free less the wines and champagnes. Snack selection was ok - cookies, nuts, M&Ms and sweets. I thought the M&Ms and Mentos sweets were cheap however, given the price paid for the rooms, I expected better quality stuff. Coffee and tea were provided, although not Nespresso, but it was acceptable. Drinks selection were the standard choices, although I wished they could stock up on more water. Ah, the bathroom. It was the highlight of the room. The bathtub was huge, and provided a stunning view of the HK skyline. Nothing beats taking a bath in it after a long day out, there was a television if you need something to watch. The standalone rainshower was great too - overall the bathroom was simply breathtaking. Amenities provided were of good quality - REN skincare. There was a pouch to take home with you too, excellent if you are taking a long flight after the stay. The bed is very comfortable, had a good night's sleep in it. The air conditioning in the bed room was not working well however, so I was feeling hot after being under the sheets for 15 mins. Had to open the doors to the living room and bathroom to get some cold air in. The wood in the bedroom was a problem too, as it creaks when one walks on it, so it was difficult to get to the bathroom without disturbing my partner sleeping. The lighting controls in the room was terribly difficult to use. In a bid to be minimalist, minimal controls were provided. There were no individual controls, and I had a hard time trying to understand how it all worked. Frustrated, I gave up after a while. The air conditioning was mediocre - the minimum temperature you could set was only 21 degrees, not enough for someone like me who likes his room cold. Views were fantastic, looking out to the harbour, and at night, the lights made it more beautiful. The numerous glass windows made the room special, and I loved how you could fall asleep amongst the skyline, or just chill with a drink looking out after a day out. Some nice touches in the room were provided, such as complimentary playing cards, a few coffee table books, iPod touch to play music etc. It was however lacking in some amenities however, e.g. iPod dock, DVD player etc. These ought to be standard amenities, given the quality of the hotel. Hotel amenities: There was a lounge at the top floor of the hotel, opposite the restaurant. Some good selection of graphic books, but that was all to it. The fireplace was supposedly a highlight, it was nice, but unimpressive. No drinks or snacks provided at the lounge, which is a pity. There was a gym just one floor below, a small and cosy gym, with some cardio machines and a few high tech machines. There were some free weights too. Free earphones to plug into the cardio machines were provided, together with towels, water, apples and muesli bars. A garden was located at the lobby level, again, the design is minimalist, nothing much except a few lounge chairs. There was free WiFi provided throughout the hotel, the speeds however was somewhat slow. Not acceptable as high speed internet is very cheap in HK. Service: If there is one thing this hotel is lacking, it would be the service provided. Staff were generally indifferent, they didn't bother any greetings, except for a few who were pleasant and warm. One gets the feeling that they were somewhat stuck up, and this added to the whole 'cold' feeling the hotel was giving out. Check out was quick and easy, they will automatically charge to your credit card once you check out, no papers to sign etc. You can view the bill on your television screen if you like; a good idea since I was rushing to the airport. Check out staff were miles friendlier, so they did redeem themselves a little at the end. Overall, I cannot help but get the feeling that this hotel places too much emphasis on design but not on the experience itself. The rooms were great, but that's about all to it: a design heavy hotel but poor on execution.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Depac
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night on a two day stop over to Oz. This was the best hotel we have ever stayed in. Truly amazing - staff, check-in (all done via I-pad), huge rooms with free standing bath & separate shower with amazing views from windows on all sides. Complimentary soft drinks/beer/nuts/sweets/tea/coffee. Great location and limited but delightful outdoor space. Fantastic restaurant with views. Not cheap, but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Incomparable. A retreat from the bustle of HK”
Reviews.Author: wallyQ
Reviews.Content: Incomparable hotel. Quiet Luxury. Its an Oasis of calm in the bustle of Hong Kong. The Rooms very well designed. Spacious. Luxurious. Amazing Bathroom. your own urban spa. great amenities. Free Mini Bar. Nespresso. Unlimited Snacks. Convenient location on Pacific Place.

Reviews.Title: “Super cool and Trendy”
Reviews.Author: joanna345
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our 3 night stay here. My boyfriend has stayed here a few times before and is beginning to get irritated by the trendiness of it!! It's very contemporary and the rooms are spacious (apparently by Hong Kong standards). Very very impressive bathroom, we both agreed we would like one like this at home! Fabulous view out even if you're not facing the harbour, we kept the curtains open all the time. I did one night hear music coming from another room, other than that, it was quiet. The free mini bar is a nice touch, they only charge for wine, so you can drink and have as many snacks as you like! The gym was great, lovely view from the treadmill. The restaurant was lovely, although we only had breakfast there. The bar is wonderful, we went for a glass of wine there as soon as we arrived, a great place to experience Hong Kong for the first time. We had friends back for a 'nightcap' and they love it to. Loved all the bathroom products to and the complimentary washbag filled with useful things, another lovely touch. My only comment is that after 3 nights, it started to feel a little claustrophobic, not sure whether this is the design that makes you feel like that or whether it's the buildings outside...

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but a bit naughty on the room charge”
Reviews.Author: nittypicker
