Reviews.Content: I booked this for my partner's birthday and overall had a good experience. Positives: * Very efficient and welcoming booking process. The concierge/guest experience team seemed to go well beyond the call of duty by asking what could be done to make the experience better (they provided a DVD player in the room so we could watch DVDs for example). They organised restaurant bookings in their own place and elsewhere in advance. They also noticed that it was my partner's birthday and asked about his interests so they could buy an appropriate gift * Friendly checking in procedure. No paperwork, it's all done in the room on an ipad. Can imagine some people might not like that but this particular girl was chatty and friendly, and we were in no rush so was fine * Well appointed room. The hotel is new, so there wasn't any shabbiness. Very automated with remote control lighting and curtains etc. For Hong Kong, it was very spacious too. * Views on 38th floor. They do make a fuss about reminding you to shut the curtains at night so that others can't see in! Helpful as it can be easy to enjoy looking out when at that height * Good food in their restaurant (can't remember name but it's on the top floor) * Wireless internet and free mini-bar snacks and soft drinks. Nothing rubs us up the wrong way more than extortionate charges for these in normal hotels. It was one of the main factors in booking this hotel originally! (it was a debate between this and the mandarin oriental) Cons: * I specificially booked a harbour view room, since my partner loves it (we used to live in HK), plus we got engaged in front of it. But it wasn't really visible unless you stood in the far corner of the room and looked round the side of the building. Naturally I assumed that this couldn't be the harbour room but didn't want to make a huge fuss (they had said the hotel was fully booked) - also we were recovering from NYE party (!) However, I did double check this when checking out (you don't receive a paper bill to check these things so I had to ask). I was told it was a 'partial harbour view' room. I disputed this and after a bit of attempting to get out of it ("ah but it's a larger floor size".. "it's the same floor size as the city view room of the same category, which is cheaper" etc.) and checking the internet booking form to see if I was lying, they conceded the difference. I did double check this had been corrected when I received the bill via email, and it had * I had to ask three times for extra drinking water to be delivered and it never arrived. Not great after a New Year's Eve weekend in Hong Kong * When changing the TV in the bedroom, the remote control activates the TV in the bathroom. Bit annoying when either a) you want to watch different things in different rooms, and b) it doesn't always work and you end up watching one and overhearing another, or one doesn't turn off when you shut down for the night. Not a dealbreaker, but didn't seem well thought out * Another small issue, but there is a separate mini-room in the bathroom for the toilet. The huge bathroom has a light switch but I personally don't feel the need to light an entire mass of space just for a tiny cubicle, especially at night when the other half is sleeping. If they could add another switch in there, maybe with a dimmer even (!) then it would be an improvement. Again, not a deal-breaker * Location is ok, and great in the grand scheme of Hong Kong. For a tourist that wants to do all the designer shopping it's great, right next to Pacific Place. Can be a bit difficult to find at first as taxi drivers don't know it, but you just need to tell them it's next to the Marriott (by Pacific Place). Can get out at the Marriott lobby, it's about 10metres away * They didn't actually provide any gift to my partner! After all the emails back and forth I was quite looking forward to seeing what they came up with. There were a few things wrapped up (branded pen, notebook etc) which I thought must be the gift, but when we checked out there was a big bundle of similar looking presents so maybe this was the christmas/new year thing they did. There was also no card of mention of his birthday during the stay so they must have forgotten it. Not a deal-breaker again, but gives the impression they are not totally on top of their game. Overall, it was very good and I would recommend it. If I had a choice between this and the Penninsula, I'd definitely choose the latter - for a start, if you book a harbour-view room, you actually do get a harbour view room (and it is amazing). A hotel like this doesn't need to resort to those sorts of gimmicks to get a few extra bucks out of its guests. For the other 'cons', I'm tempted to give the benefit of the doubt as it's new. But I would hope it sorts them out and doesn't end up one of these 'style over substance' trendy hotels.

Reviews.Title: “It was my birthday - so they gave me a birthday cake. What more can you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: pmalam
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have lived in Hong Kong for about four years now and in our opinion The Upper House is the best hotel in Hong Kong. The rooms are spectacular. We booked the cheapest one and found it was really a suite rather than a room. It didn't face the harbour but still had a fantastic view all the way from Admiralty (near the centre of town) to Causeway Bay (to the East). This is because the floors are so high up (we were on the 42nd floor) and enhanced by almost floor to ceiling windows. The decor in the room is very contemporary with lots of natural materials used in its fixtures and fittings. The bed was king size and comfortable. The bathroom was very stylishly decorated and has a separate bath and (rain) shower. For convenience and privacy, the toilet is in its own separate part of the suite. The bathroom has electric blinds controlled with a special remote (so you can open and close them from the bath if like!) There is also a TV recessed into a wall above the bath. It is possible to listen to the audio from the bedroom TV in the bathroom. So, if you want to watch the bathoom TV, first make sure you turn down the volume on the bedroom TV using the buttons on the wall next to the bathroom's (double) sinks . Otherwise you will hear audio from both TVs at the same time. The rooms also have a "maxi" bar i.e. a super sized mini bar. All the contents are free, except the wine. This is a great idea that I wish other hotels would follow. It means you don't feel ripped off if you decide to take something from it - because, in effect, you have already paid for it. Of course, it also means that you are more likely to make the best of it before you leave! The hotel restaurant breakfast was delicious and very plentiful. It is served as in a restaurant and not a buffet, which I much prefer. It is well worth adding this to your package. As stated in the title of this review, soon after I mentioned, in passing, that it was my birthday, we found that the hotel staff had left a cake for me in the room. A special touch from a very special hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Business and Leisure location in Hong Kong, doesn't get much better then this"”
Reviews.Author: Total-Biz-Traveller
Reviews.Content: Outstanding Hotel of the upper class, amenities, brilliant, bed, soft comfy and fantastic view, bathroom so dramatic, want to take it home. all that can be thought of, has been, for me a 99 pointer

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: windance
Reviews.Content: Tranquil, spacious, amazingly well-appointed rooms in flawless setting. Having stayed multiple times at the Island Shangri-la (next door), the Peninsula and the Four Seasons, I have to say that this is my new favorite. One can forgive the check in/out via hip i-pad wielding techno-savvy staff (seemingly sharing the bell desk), because the rooms are simply stunning. The bathrooms alone are larger than many Hong Kong hotel rooms. Breakfast service is efficient and the hotel restaurant is good, although the bar scene is a bit "happening" and the noise can overwhelm dinner conversation. Location is convenient to shopping and public transport. Would recommend it without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “My choice in HK - superb”
Reviews.Author: love2travelTokyo
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at many HK hotels before...Landmark Mandarin (my old benchmark), JW Marriott, Shangri-La, Conrad...this in my opinion is the best Pros: - Outstanding rooms - just pure luxury, urban chic modern design, fantastic bathroom AND it is huge...the best hotel room I've ever stayed in. Best beds I've slept in too. Very modern with ordering done by iphones etc. Nice views. The Trump in NY and Landmark Mandarin Oriential are probably 2nd best for me - Service, decor and feel is very luxurious and 5 star, but still retains that boutique feel - Bar / restaurant upstairs is one of the places to be seen in HK - very popular, stunning views - Gym is very classy and nice, although limited number of equipment - Softest plushest bathrobes I've ever put on! - Value is surprisingly good - not that dissimilar to the other 5 stars in the area Cons: - No swimming pool - this was disappointing for a lover of a morning swim - Location is a litte further away than the Shangri-La / Conrad from the Central area - it still sits on top of Pacific Place which is great, but at the end further away from Central...but it really is only a further 2 min walk...and cabs are so cheap in HK. Overall, despite some shortcomings, still have to give this 5 star purely on the quality of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding! Undeniably best hotel in Hong Kong if not the WORLD!”
Reviews.Author: Lmerrick48
Reviews.Content: Staying at The Upper House Hotel has been incredible!! Upon arrival the staff were extremely attentive and friendly, remembering our name and asking us questions about our journey with a genuine interest. When we needed a taxi they were out on the road hailing cabs for us and making sure the taxi men knew where we wanted to go. There was no fuss when we arrived, no hassel and no conventional check in which was very refreshing. Toby showed us around our (outstanding) room showing us it's amazing features including an iPod touch in the room, from which we could order room service and listen to music among other features. The Michelin star restaurant was both cosmopolitan and intimate with impecible food and service and breathtaking views. Pricing was surprisingly affordable and the experience was more relaxed and enjoyable than stuffy fine dining. The location of the hotel is perfect, a 2 minute taxi ride, 10 minute walk from Central and directly opposite Pacific Place shopping mall, perfect if you want to be in the hub of it all but don't want to feel claustrophobic. The Upper House has a great vibe, great atmosphere and without a doubt THE best hotel i've stayed in. Thank you very much to all of the staff for an amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “could be the best hotel in the world...”
Reviews.Author: ccrr77fr
Reviews.Content: The Upper House is a new "top end" property managed by Swire perfectly located in the best of what HK has to offer: just up to the elegant mall Pacific Place, at walking distance from Central and the lively Mid Levels area or at a few steps from Causeway Bay, the shopping paradise. This excellent property occupies the last top floors of a building which is divised with an other hotel but each has its own entrance and management. Marvellously designed by André Fu, one of the most talented Hong Kong interior designer, The Upper House is like a cocoon in the middle of this vibrant city. Right away you'll get in the lobby, you'll be very surprised but impressed as well by the elegance of a decor very pure, so actual and ultra comfortable. To be honnest, i don't think i've seen such a wonderful design over the globe and despite my numerous experiences in five stars properties. Mr Fu is really a great artist. Concerning the rooms ("studios" cause the smallest one is not under 70 sq. meters...) and suites, you'll find the same atmosphere of pure elegant design with deep carpet, clear wood and large windows overlooking a breathtaking view of the mountain or the harbour. We have been allocated in a Studio 80 with a gorgeous view on the mountain side, a green scenic view we can't forget... But inside, everything was simply fabulous with a lage L-type sofa, a bed so exquisite you'll do not want to move, a complimentary mini bar with a good selcetion of soft drinks and candies and cookies, everything is a very tasteful scheme of light green, cream and grey colours. We felt a bit like being at the top of a tree and this impression is totally relaxing and just unique. But the most impressive part of our studio 80 was the bathroom full of deluxe amenities and even a travel kit full of great skincare products you'll be able to bring for your trip back home... The bathroom is a living room in itself with a dressing area, two large sinks with a perfect lighting and a few steps going to a stand alone bathtub with terrific views and a TV dissimulated behing a mirror. For people who prefer an energizing shower, no problem, you'll have a perfect rain shower available in this exclusive space. So, if there was only the design and the comfort, let's say The Upper House would be the best city hotel over the globe with a very good value if we compare with Mandarin Oriental, four Seasons or The Pen and which is able to offer a different experience. However, in an hotel, there is also the service and unfortunately, this is on what The Upper House has to work. We haven't found a great staff and first of all, on arrival, very messy, not especially smiling and not really efficient. Why not to escort us to the first floor where there is a large sitting area, simply beautiful instead of asking us to wait on a not comfy sofa located right next the the door. We have been waiting for about 15-20 minutes, time for them to find somebody to escort us to our room but we didn't feel perfectly welcomed and this is unfortunate cause it gives a disappointing impression of an hotel so beautiful. However and fortunately, the guest relations manager who escorted us was nice. However, at the restaurant, the staff is arrogant, not friendly at all... They don't wanna make customers happy and they act like in this kind of ultra trendy places i hate. Each customer has to be treated as the same and not only the VIP... Moreover, the breakfast wasn't really good, at least under the expectation you can have of such a nice place. I've talked about these problems with the management but none of them seem to be very concerned despite of a few cookies, hot milk with a GM message placed in our room as a kind of gesture... Why "hot milk"??? I don't know... Oh i forgot, we received a candie and an umbrella as gifts on departure where staff was a bit more efficient but i regret the GM didn't call me... To conclude, yes, i still recommend The Upper House i consider as the best hotel in HK. At least simply for the decor which is just impressive and the comfort absolutely unparralelled. So i just hope the service will change and become more professionnal and nice and if yes, in that case, The Upper House will be a urban paradise...

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel right in the heart of Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: mschoe64
Reviews.Content: Very trendy and modern luxury hotel, great rooms, very spacious, everything felt brand new, fantastic service (as almost everywhere in Asia), definitely worth trying when you are in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Service, views--and SPACE!”
Reviews.Author: jackandstace
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights on a business trip to HK in the Upper House. Was upgraded to a suite on the 41st floor--all I can say is "wow". HK is a terribly crowded city, and the hotel rooms reflect that--usually small, cramped and expensive. The Upper House was spacious and expansive, although still expensive. My 1250 sq ft suite overlooked the harbor and Kowloon, beautiful views, great living area, bed was confortable, bath area was 4 separate rooms (large vanity area with two sinks, separate toilet, walk-in rain shower room and huge tub with panoramic views of the city. Service was excellent, but not invasive. A first rate hotel--highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Brandon228
Reviews.Content: modern minimalist but warm decor. All that one could wish for ie Free mini bar, free snacks. Great views , space in abundance. Little extras such as free wifi , complimentary shoe shine. Add a great cafe on the top floor, proximity to pacific place mall . Perfect just perfect. I'll be BACK !

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best hotel I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: SWCSydney
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent business traveller and to be totally honest am totally sick of hotel rooms. I am lucky enough to stay in some excellent hotels but work is still work and most hotels feel like work. When it was time to take my wife on her first overseas trip I needed to find somewhere very special. I did loads of research on Trip Advisor and decided on The Upper House. I just cannot find a bad word to say about the place, in short; The rooms are amazing, every room is high so the views are to die for. The bathroom is incredible. We have taken lots of photos and plan on replicating it the next time we build. The service is very professional and first rate. The restaurant is very good with a good selection to choose from. I wish every check in was so simple and easy. No stopping, straight to your room. Love the iPod and being able to order room service electronically. How many hotels offer free mini bar including chocolates, biscuits and drinks? We used very little but that's not the point, we could of and that meant something. It's centrally located and close to everything. The shopping centre has a brilliant grocery store in the basement, I have never seen a range of products like this. if you stay here make sure you go down and check it out! Wi-Fi is free and very fast. Taxis generally found it hard to get there, just tell them the Marriott or the Hilton, they are all near by. If you want to stay somewhere where you feel special this is the place. Only problem is I have set the bar too high. My wife thinks this is the life I lead on every trip, I wish!! I highly recommend spending some time at The Upper House.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic...”
Reviews.Author: TJLM44
Reviews.Content: This is a great boutique hotel! The rooms are very modern, super high quality and spacious, and the bathroom is one of the best I have seen. It is a paperless hotel, with checkin done on an iPad and all room services accessed via an iPod Touch (very cool). The staff are great; very friendly and helpful. There is a great bar/restaurant on the top floor with a stunning view of the harbour. The location is great - not that anything is too far away in Hong Kong. The hotel sits above the Pacific Fair Shopping Centre with just about every conceivable brand store imaginable. The only negative is that, as a boutique hotel, there is no pool or spa - but there are lots of options (especially on the spa front). Its not cheap, but you wouldn't expect it to be.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing hotel experience in HK”
Reviews.Author: sol500
Reviews.Content: An amazing addition to the HK hotel scene. Rooms are big, super-sized windows offer spectacular views, interior decoration is serene. The complimentary bar/espresso machine/snacks are fab. The less experienced traveler might find the pared down 'general services' a little sub-standard (concierge, reception and bell hop is all one - 'guest experience'). The restaurant on the top floor is highly recommendable, with a bar area that hums for drinks. The gym is a bit basic (two exercise bikes, two or three running machines), but with good attendants.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of The Upper House!”
Reviews.Author: SambhaIndia
Reviews.Content: We had originally made reservations at The JW Marriot and then decided to change to The Upper House as we wanted the more personalized experience of a boutique hotel. This was a HUGE mistake. 2 days after checkout, the hotel sent me an email that they would be debiting HKD 2500 from my credit card due to a fault in the hotels window blinds that they subsequently discovered. This was absolutely shocking as an Upper House staff had checked the room during the time we checked out and had failed to notice anything. Despite emails to them they have gone ahead and billed our credit card for the amount and have refused to roll back the said amount. Staying there was a HUGE mistake and we will not go back there during our subsequent trips.

Reviews.Title: “You'll never want to leave this masterpiece of hotel-keeping”
Reviews.Author: Seanno
Reviews.Content: I admit to being nervous about staying at Upper House. A self-confessed Four Seasons Hong Kong junkie, I thought that no hotel could ever match its impeccable service, stunning location, unbelievable facilities and F&B. Boy, was I wrong. Upper House just blew me away - exceeded all expectations and then some. I had more OMG moments in this smallish, stunning boutique hotel in the very convenient Pacific Place than I care to remember. Let’s start with reception: nice and discrete ground floor welcome, warm and enthusiastic without being gushy from an impeccably groomed and professional team. It also smelled gorgeous. We were terribly early (7:30am) and not expecting our rooms to be ready. No problem at all, and a suite upgrade to boot! Immediately whisked away for a comfortable in-room check-in, we had our first OMG moment – the jaw-dropping views of HKG harbour. Then we focussed on the room, HUGE barely describes it. Sprawling more like it, and oh so comfortable. More OMG moments followed – the fit-out and interior detailing all extraordinary. Beautiful timbers, impeccable craftsmanship, easy to operate touch-button controls for everything; brilliant lighting, TV and in-built sound system wiring the iPod to all rooms, including bathroom. A minibar with complimentary beer, soft drinks and juices – there is a God! And oh, what a bathroom – two rooms actually, one with twin vanities and TWO inbuilt dressing tables and stools, separate loo and more space than you’ll every use; then into a corridor, up some broad, flat, LED under-lit stairs to the pièce de résistance, the ‘bath’ room. A free-standing, centre-of-room bath surrounded by picture windows with HKG and its harbour spread beneath you. Covetous REN products complemented this spectacular offering. Tucked behind, a large cubicle with rain-shower seemed almost superfluous but equally inviting. It was then off to Café Gray Deluxe for breakfast and service that was so sharp and on-the-ball it almost made you weep with joy. Highly attentive, knowledgeable and thoroughly accommodating, staff could not do enough. You knew they really cared. Needless to say the food was beyond delicious and the coffee, without doubt, the best in town. We returned later for afternoon tea (book through a Virtuoso travel agent and it's complimentary, as was the room upgrade) and the best I’ve ever had – so contemporary, flavoursome and original it puts all the others to shame. Sorry Peninsular, your high-tea is well and truly trumped here. The adjacent bar proved a knock-out venue for cocktails that evening – very pricey but with the level 49 views and supremely comfortable all-window nooks it was incomparable. The interior design and comfort here and in the café brings more OMG moments. No, there is neither pool nor spa at Upper House, only a small but useful gym. No big deal though - I popped 20m across the road to the Shangri-la to do all that. Great facilities and not the least bit inconvenient. And a pool that almost rivals the Four Seasons’. Upper House was one hotel I never wanted to leave. A flask of warm milk and cookies on turndown was a nice touch but the take-away espresso waiting at 5:45am on checkout really sold me. I’ll return to the Four Seasons when I feel like a resort-type stay, but every other time I’ll be back to Upper House. It was like being in the home you might create in your dreams.

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong's Top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: drummingtosca
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Upper House is an incredible experience. After having had toilets that were literally in a closet right next to the bed due to the small size of Hong Kong's hotel rooms, to walk into the Upper House's smallest room available, open the connecting sliding door, to discover gorgeous, modern sinks, separate toilet, a stand alone bathtub overlooking the harbor, walk-in rain shower, AND a sizable dressing area, was a great pleasure. The king size bed was super comfortable. The sofa in the room, again overlooking the harbor, was a particularly inviting place to curl up with a good book or nice TV show on the iPad. The service at the hotel was impeccable, and the cookies in the room were really delicious. It is a real testament to how comfortable the Upper House was that we spent over 50% of our weekend in our hotel room, when we were in one of the greatest cities in the world with so much to do outside!

Reviews.Title: “Has to be one of the best in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: UKRegulartraveller
Reviews.Content: I've been lucky enough to stay in some of what are considered to be top end hotels in Hong Kong. They need to watch out for this new kid on the block. Opened in Oct 2009, the Upper House is everything you expect from a luxury hotel and more. Where to start? The rooms are big, the bathrooms jaw dropping, the linen amongst the best I've ever slept upon. Ren toiletries, a washbag full of goodies and a mini bar that's free (apart from wine and champagne). Every little detail has been thought through; some of the best minds in the hotel business must have designed these rooms. There's the i-touch linked to the hotel system to create a paper free environment, the flask of hot milk and home-made biscuits waiting for me when I arrived late at night, a magnificent, yet easy to use, coffee machine together with a toaster (room service will deliver bread) neatly tucked away. The list goes on. The obligatory high rise bar and restaurant were buzzing and deliver on the city scape view. There's a small but well equipped gym, but honestly, why would you want to leave your room. You'd expect staff in a hotel of this calibre to be friendly, but people went out of the their way to be welcoming. The Upper House has a sister hotel, the Opposite House, in Beijing. Both are owned by Swire Hotels. I don't know of any others but, based on this experience, I'd actively seek out their hotels in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Jewel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: LChung
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in all the top hotels in Hong Kong including the 4 Seasons and Inter Con. Hotel. We love this hotel the most because of the size of the rooms, the beautiful bathroom and its location. We stayed at the 850 sq. ft studio with the view of the mountain and harbor, the decor was modern and sheek the King Size Bed was very comfortable and the bathroom is amazing and you can watch TV while taken a bath. The top floor lounge has a wrap around view of the city. Did not get a chance to try the restaurant but I heard from the GM Mr. Ben the food is very good and the lunch menu is quite reasonable. I am looking forward to stay there again on the coming trip, it was a delightful experience for my family. By the way, you can hop on the taxi to go almost any where or you can take the MTR for longer trips. The Hong Kong Park was just right behind the hotel and highly recommend it for a stroll in the park (pls remember to use bug repellent for protection from the tinny bugs that fly around and bits you, you cannot even see them with your eyes)

Reviews.Title: “Just gorgeous.”
Reviews.Author: aussie1961
Reviews.Content: Restrained minimalism with warmth. Beautiful tactile finishes and colours combine to create a relaxed haven, high in the sky above the frantic pace of Hong Kong. After a smooth as silk check in, we kicked off our shoes, relaxed on the comfy sofa and gazed out over a stuning view of the harbour. It's all about peace and tranquility here. Very Zen. We stayed in an Upper Suite and the wow factor continued from the lounge area in to the bedroom and finally, one of the most stunning hotel bathrooms around. Ascend the shallow, underlit, stone steps from the main part of the bathroom, and you are greeted by a huge tub with it's own dramatic views which feels like it's in it's own separate wing. Gorgeous amenities. They have thought of everything to make you welcome in this "home way from home". Although the shopping of Hong Kong beckoned below, this place made us just want to chill a little while longer before hitting the streets. Staff here are very young, attentive and the service discreet. No question, this is our new home when in Hong Kong. We love the paperless policy (everything is done through the rooms i pod) the technology in the rooms, lighting, amenties, fine collecction of books, an Hermes throw rug to cuddle in the lobby, the sculptures in the bathroom, 2 differnt types of robe, the extra bag for extra shopping, the Lexus airport transfers...etc etc etc... We only got to stay one night, but we will be back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Blowaway experience- absolute top-of-the-line. Couldn't have asked for a better hotel experience.”
Reviews.Author: emmalove443
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Upper House with my husband on our honeymoon, and the two of us were simply 'wow-ed' from the very first moment. It was the easiest check-in we've ever had as a lovely staff member showed us directly to our suite and checked us in right there...we never had to stop at a front desk. They gifted us chocolate covered strawberries and complimentary champagne. The views are to die for. The suite was 1200+ sq. feet, and every detail was simply sumptuous...from the most amazing shower EVER to the padded window seat where you can soak in the views. We've stayed in many 5 star hotels around the world (and sometimes 6) and this one tops the charts- it was very modern and it seemed every design decision was made with the guest in mind. We so appreciated that the luxury was geared more to our generation's sense of style (we're in our 30's) than our parents'. It felt young, fresh, hip and modern...but still had the ultimate in luxury in every detail. The staff even left us a parting gift of two books about China, and a complimentary ride back to the airport. We were humbled by the level of grace and generosity shown to us for our honeymoon. Even the restaurant was incredible, and a must for dining! I had read about it in Town & Country magazine and it exceeded all expectations. THANK YOU UPPER HOUSE! We LOVED it. Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “For once Outstanding means Outstanding..”
Reviews.Author: DemandingAlbion
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in so many good hotels around the world, many of whom boast about their stars, service, being exemplary at this or that, it takes a lot to make me pause and take notice, much less to enthuse. But I did all of these, after my first experience of the Upper House. Mind you, even getting me to try it was somewhat of a struggle, as for the last however many years, I have loyally stayed at the Mandarin. However a number of friends, whose advice I really trust, urged me to give it a go. As I am doing this review rather late in the day (after having decided that writing reviews for Tripadvisor is maybe useful), I will not bang on about all the aspects that impressed me. But highlights were; the view (better than the Mandarin or Four Seasons), Rooms (amazingly spacious and well designed), the Bathrooms (even better than the Mandarin’s new(ish) suite bathrooms), generous and high quality bath stuff and I love the no-charge minibar policy (I know its a bit corny but I am one of those people who just hate that feeling of being ripped off for every last cent when you are already paying six star prices). Only one quibble - the snooty manager of Cafe Grey, who despite the fact that I had a table by the window booked, gave me grief in front of my (rather distinguished) guests. Something that would never happen in the Mandarin. Which just goes to show that simply hiring a few staff from the hotel with the best people in Asia in not in itself enough to instill a true culture of service. Everything else outstanding...

Reviews.Title: “The Upper House”
Reviews.Author: benny92221333
Reviews.Content: The Upper house offers free flow of beverages in the mini bar. Spacious and comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Universalnomads
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The rooms are large, calming with a modern aesthetic. Nice touches such as the use of an iPod to order room service and information about the hotel and surrounding area, great bathroom products and a fantastic bed. Mavis at the front desk was very helpful and professional. Service at Cafe Grey was a bit patchy but not a major issue. All in all a calming, modern and soothing place to stay in busy Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Upper House at upper end of scale”
Reviews.Author: cpctraveller
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel in a great location with fantastic rooms and views. What more can I say? We were greated by courteous and friendly team who were indeed please to welcome us to the hotel. After enjoying a wondeful lunch at the Cafe Grey on the 49th floor, we were escorted to our room. You could not wish for any more features in the room which also included an expresso machine, itouch for ordering room service and even playing cards if you ever tired of the scenic view of Hong Kong Harbour. The room was modern and the seperate bathrroom had a large rain forrest shower and an equally large bath. Overall, the experience could not be faulted.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in Asia”
Reviews.Author: taipa
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Studio 80 a couple times. The interior design is the main attraction of this hotel. The design is so elegant and soothing.. It is really sanctuary from busy HK. Once you get to your room, you will not want to leave... The bath robes are probably the finest I have ever experienced. The minibar and snacks are FREE. The sound system hooks up easily to your ipod or MP3 player. The floor-to-ceiling views from the bathroom / spa are stunning. This is probably the finest hotel I've ever stayed in. Expect to pay $450 to $500 a night, but considering HK, it is very worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Near perfect - My choice for Hong Kong!”
Reviews.Author: aferret
Reviews.Content: Usually staying at the traditional 5 and 4 star hotels in Hong Kong, I decided to give the newly opended Upper House a try on my 3 day trip. Transfer from the airport in the hotel's Lexus is smooth, the in-room check-in reminds me more of a friendly chat than usual protocol. The room (I had the smaller one) is huge, the design clean, minimalistic and functional. Furthermore I like the concept of the complimentary minibar (well, it's not really mini...) and snacks. Bar and restaurant are nice, too. Staff is young, yet attentive and friendly; however, they could enhance on speed (e.g. fetching stored lugguage took 15 minutes). If you like a stylish hotel combined with some understatement, then I definitely recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Cafe Gray Deluxe (Hotel signature restaurant)”
Reviews.Author: AnthonyHKHongKong
Reviews.Content: In the heart of Pacific Place, lies the Upper House Hotel, being the inaugural Hong Kong Hotel for the Swire group. Just getting to the restaurant is an experience in itself; certainly in the evening the ambiance sets the tone for what’s in store. While modern minimalism is a feature of the Hotel, making ones way up the long sleek escalator with warm teak wood hues gives way to a lift lobby that then takes you to the top floor of the Hotel wherein lies on the 49th Floor Café Gray Deluxe. A short candle lit hall leads to the interior. With the bar and cosy semi private booths on the right and the main dining area straight ahead, the inimitable style and refined aesthetics are both soothing and sophisticated. Service It’s not that hard to build and create a great looking restaurant, however, while one can build and create the most amazing places on earth it takes people to make them a reality. This is where Café Gray Deluxe exceeds expectations. Quality service should always be unobtrusive yet professional and efficient. Café Gray Deluxe is both. More than that, it’s carried out in a genuinely caring manner. Making this a place where casual meets sheik with attention to service. On our visit our service was superb and again proves that in Hong Kong, it is indeed the five star hotels that can attract and retain quality people. Food While there has been “mixed” reports in the media on the food, on our visit we ordered a variety of dishes, all of which were both enticing and delicious. Mixed Oysters with Crab legs (the latter already carefully slice open for easy access) being tastefully presented on a bed of ice, both the Oysters and the Crab were of the freshest and finest. Other dishes to follow where: Pork Chops tenderly cooked with a nice selection of vegetables, a whole Lemon Sole cooked to perfection with a tangy light lemon sauce, and Beef Cheeks, being tender and gelatinous accompanied by a light sauce and medley of vegetables. Now this is were some other reviews had differing thoughts, but my point is this. Good food done well, prepared fresh and with attention to detail is the key to success. It is a simple as that, and while some diners may have different conceptions or follow other fads in reality there is no need for food to be convoluted or complicated. This is where Café Gray Deluxe excels, with quality produce and a traditional approach, neither will never go out of style. Overall it further elevates the dining status for which Hong Kong is famous. Dining at Café Gray Deluxe can be like dining anywhere else in the world and certainly comparable to, Tokyo, London, Paris and New York. No doubt the fact the Chef Gray Kunz, spent sometime at a very successful establishment in New York, evokes a major influence in this dining venue. Personally I can’t wait to go back there!

Reviews.Title: “Good- one of my new favourites in HK”
Reviews.Author: scalpel73
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for business - sadly just for 1 night. Great room - with awesome views of the bay. Huge bath area and spacious room- all the high tech gadgets etc. Good location for work- efficient staff. Great bar on the top floor. Had room service breakfast which was good. Not cheap and the gym is a bit small- but otherwise hard to fault.

Reviews.Title: “Jaw dropping suite”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryLoverLondon
Reviews.Content: Normally stay at Mandarin Oriental but had a two day stop over at the end of a trip to China and had been recommended this hotel. Booked an Upper Suite Harbour View which was absolutely stunning. All elements were as expected of the best luxury hotel (except, oddly, the bathroom dressing gowns seemed to be made of a soft synthetic material rather than the normal toweling - but I am being picky here!). If you just need the best room in HK and do not need the other amenities of a 5 large hotel (more than one bar/restaurant) then the Upper House is hard to fault.

Reviews.Title: “Superdeluxe hotel, beautiful bamboo furnished”
Reviews.Author: aardbei
Reviews.Content: This must have been one of the most beautiful city hotels we have ever stayed in. The reception is minimalist, all staff were dressed casually smart in fitted sweaters and something that looked like track pants : ). The room was just amazing. Everything is done in bamboo, the bathroom, never mind the view, was just stunning. Bath oils, shampoos etc from REN smelled gorgeous. If you want to pamper your self, try a night in Upper house. Oh and the maxi bar is free, yippie!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Prestigehomme
Reviews.Content: The Upper House is truly the first modern luxury hotel ever existed in Hong Kong. From the moment I arrive at the hotel to my depature, every minute of my experience was pampered by their understated excellence and personalized service. My room was larger than any other hotels that I have ever stayed in Hong Kong, a zen like bathroom equipped with rainshower and soaking tub, a complimentary mini-bar with all kinds of treats and a bed that melts you away to sleep. I have noticed the previous reviewer made a comment about the hotel discriminating towards the asian community. And the truth is, I am a proud asian and felt that I was being treated like a VIP guest. Their attention to details and their courteous attitude really made me feel at home. And I definitely need to recommend their scrumptious floating dessert and Hong Kong Highball (cocktail long drink) at Cafe Gray Deluxe, it's to die for!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But Discriminates Against Chinese”
Reviews.Author: go49ers
Reviews.Content: I was a guest at the hotel on March 12-22, 2010. Overall, my stay was very pleasant and I enjoyed the service provided by almost all of the staff. However, the hotel has “Guest Experience Managers” who do the job of doorman and bellhop. They also escort you to your room where they check you in. On several occasions, while waiting to be picked up by a friend, I observed a particular Guest Experience Manager (he is Caucasian) who was posted at the main entrance. Without exception, he only approached Caucasian patrons to offer his services (carrying luggage, calling cabs, opening car doors, etc.). Chinese people were ignored. When I complained to the manager of the hotel, he was very defensive and I didn’t get a satisfactory response. I cannot recommend this hotel to any proud Asian until they change this colonial superiority. Pros: color scheme of room, shower/tub area is very spacious and nicely appointed Cons: lighting in room & closet is very dim, alarm clock is tiny-cannot read from more than 2 ft away, desk is cramped

Reviews.Title: “If only all hotels were like the Upper House.”
Reviews.Author: PenguinandSpecial
Reviews.Content: The Upper House achieves a balance between the amenities, service and quality of finish of a Four Seasons, Grand Hyatt or similar and the intimacy and passion of a boutique hotel, rarely seen in a big city hotel. To date, I've only stayed at The Upper House on business, but wouldn't think twice about staying here were I in Hong Kong on holiday with my wife. There are four elements that mean I will always come back to The Upper House when I'm in Hong Kong. Firstly, the quality and consistency of service delivered by Marcel and his team is a pleasure to experience, from being met at the entrance to the hotel with a friendly handshake, to the fantastic room service food and service, to the pain free 'wireless' check out. Secondly, I love the fact that the WiFi is free, the shower gel is REN, there is a well stocked (and free) fridge full of beer, water, juice and milk, and an espresso machine. As one previous reviewer noted, the hotel has been thoughtfully configured to meet the needs of travellers. Thirdly, I love the clean lines and the cleverly designed rooms; who wouldn't with the smallest room circa 70sqm and a bathtub that allows you to both watch TV and gaze over Hong Kong Harbour. Finally, for a business traveller in his early thirties, its a pleasure to finally find a hotel with a bit of style, verve and passion in its design and realisation. My congratulations to the The Upper House team for a great product.

Reviews.Title: “The Best I Have Experienced”
Reviews.Author: ZAK12003
Reviews.Content: The Upper House has been the best hotel I have ever stayed in. I had chosen the Easter Package which included airport pick/drop by limousine and breakfast. As soon as I walked outside the customs check at the airport, there was a hotel representative waiting for me at the arrivals hall. She took my luggage and escorted me directly to the Mercedes waiting for me outside. She asked me about my flight and if I had been to HK before. The warmth made me feel like I was being received by someone I knew. When I got inside the car the driver gave me a cold towel and a bottle of water to make the ride more comfortable. Great touch. When I arrived at the hotel there was someone waiting for me outside and she greeted me by my name. She took me directly up to my room and explained the whole concept behind the hotel. The mini bar (including the beer not the wine) and all the snacks were free. Wifi was also complimentary. They have a great selection of amenities and other knickknacks which you’ll discover. There whole room including the curtains can be controlled by one remote. The room and bathroom were one of the most spacious I have seen with a beautiful layout; modern yet comfortable. There was a walk in closet, separated toilet, shower, and bath. The hotel is 100% smoke free. The bath and shower was like a picture from an interior design magazine. The breakfast also was the best I have ever had. It was a la carte with gourmet cuisine. The check out and drop back to the airport was with the same level of service as the pick. There was a hotel representative waiting at the airport who upon my drop even checked me in! Amazing. The location of the hotel is next to Pacific Place ( a high end mall) which has the MTR right underneath and easily gets you to wherever you need to go. There is also a great grocery store in the mall. I would without any hesitation stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Finally, they get good service”
Reviews.Author: mhshanghai
Reviews.Content: I arrived here last night with mixed expectation. I've been to their sister hotel in Beijing - The Opposite House - to eat and drink and it's a fabulous venue, bordering on being a little too stylish and maybe a little cold side of cool. The UH in HK is probably the best customer service I've had from a hotel as long as I can remember. From the minute i got out of the taxi, I was shown a seat and then quickly accompanied to my room. It was only then that the passport and credit cards were requested. A nice touch not to have to queue in a lobby. The hotel staff then gave me a little tour of the room and highlighted some of the unique features. The room itslef is huge for the standards typical in HK, Tokyo, London or New York. It is beautifully stylish. The large bathroom with bath overlooking HK harbour is wonderful and they have very nice design touches everywhere. The iPod Touch system to get to know the hotel ammenities and to order room service works as an 'ooh' moment but when I ordered room service, I still got a phone call to confirm, so no real benefit for the customer I don't think. Where they missed a trick is to have music pre-loaded on the iPod, although they do have cables to hook up your own music if you have it with you. The best thing about this place though is that the people who developed it are obviously seasoned travellers and understand what drives most people crazy - the additional charges. The fact that UH do not charge for internet access, do not charge for standard beers and soft drinks from the mini bar, coffee and cookies - to the extent there's even a sign inviting you to take the candy home if you want to. Thsi tells me they get it and it makes such a huge difference. I went for a look at their top floor bar and restaurant but decided to come back to the room as the restaurant isn't really the place for lone diners - but did look great - and the bar had a function on. The fact I couldn't go to their only bar was the only disappointment I had during the stay and I think they need to rethink this policy. When I got back to my room there was a souvenir gift of a rugby ball to celebrate the HK 7s weekend, which I thought was another nice touch. Overall, this hotel has the slickness and quality feel of the Conrad or Grand hyatt, with the style of Jia. Together a very potent combination and this is definitely a first choice hotel for any trip to HK for me.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, spacious, cool, great views and brilliant service”
Reviews.Author: MrsT71
Reviews.Content: The rooms are huge, the views are great and the bar is fantastic. But, most of all, the staff can't do enough to help. We had some suggestions of things to do from a friend who used to live in HK and the staff were brilliant at recommending what we should do from the list given weather conditions, the length of our stay, our energy levels etc. They then proceeded to book restaurants, unbook them when we changed our minds and were generally without fault. If you want a stylish hotel in Hong Kong, but don't like the thought of disappearing into the bowels of a Four Seasons, an Intercontinental or a Mandarin Oriental, then the Upper House is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “over the top”
Reviews.Author: helleha
Reviews.Content: beautiful rooms, very competent service, a view thats fantastic and very god service

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: bumd168
Reviews.Content: Amazing boutique hotel. Great views. Awesome serene contemporary vibe. Largest room in Hong Kong. I stayed there for almost 2 weeks over Xmas and New Years. Was upgraded to a Studio 80 room....very large for one person, and would be very large for even two people by American standards. The bathroom is 400 square feet! Rain forest shower had an infinity edge. Huge tub with a television built into a mirro. Very minimalist look. The bath supplies from Ren were awesome. You will not need to bring ANY toiletries....some of the things that were supplied I didn't even really know existed (glycolic face masks, day creams, night creams). Complimentary shoe shine service. Great bar on the top floor with stunning views. There is a maxi bar in the room with almost everything free from bottled water, beer, sodas, coffee, and snacks. Feels like a home. Great gym also. Yes, there is no pool or spa, but the room and hotel itself makes up for it.....I'm returning to HK in May, and will definitely stay here again.....

Reviews.Title: “Quiet haven of calm”
Reviews.Author: Mchristie2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days last week and it was best hotel we have stayed in to date - better than the Wynn, Bellagio, Gansevoort etc. It is easily the best bathroom we have had.... Huge bath, shower and lighting and styling in it are testament to Andre Fus vision. Every part of the hotel works together and has been thought out so that it all flows. The Cafe Gray deluxe is superb and the special at lunch was a great price. I can only recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “My ultimate HK escape... A Must Do for all travellers.."”
Reviews.Author: ShanghaiPatty
Reviews.Content: Having worked in the hotel industry for many years i am naturally cynical and HK at best for me is a challenge - pricewise and product wise... but i am delighted to say the Upper House exceeded my expectations on every level. From the minute i arrived i was treated like a return guest, a friend in a home or even dare i say it a resident in a penthouse apartment. The staff knew my name, where i was from, my company etc etc and delighted in making me feel welcome and relaxed. The room design is excellent esp for business travellers and female guests will delight in the in room ammenities by REN and the Maxi bar - with its Illy Coffee Machine. The bar - restaurants and general public areas are fantastic and the hotels location is perfect for shopping, dining, relaxing and accessing Airport Express and of course areas in HK.. I will definately return and can recommend Room 4009 - book it to reignite your spirits, relax with a loved one - or have comfort on business.. you wont be disappointed.. Big thank you to Toby and his guest experience team.... very very good!

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel but not when you travel with kids”
Reviews.Author: cko1908
Reviews.Content: When I visit HK (regardless business or leisure), I usually stay at the Marriott, but knowing from my friend in HK that this boutique hotel has opened and it's the same location, thought to give a try.... The check-in experience was very diffrent then other regular hotel, we were escort to the Suite straight (which is excellent after a long journey for my kids) and was checked-in remotely....maybe that's the reason the Upper House don't need a proper reception in their tiny lobby. The view of the Suite was gorgeous (because all the rooms are located from 36+ floors above), first impression of this the room was very plain with lots of hidden walls and equipment, woody decor that gives you an apartment feel. The Hotel has only one restaurant , alternative would be room service. If your expectation is only a good night sleep and breakfast, this hotel would be your choice, because that's all they have!!! Originally we booked for 4 nights, but decided to check-out early on the 2nd night and moved to next door. The overall experience was pleasant, but the shortage of facilities such as swimming pool, sauna, spa, recreation made my stay in HK less entertaining. I would prefer a "full service" hotel (especially travel with children) in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Hotel with Suberb Staff”
Reviews.Author: LynHSydney
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from 6 nights in an Upper Suite at the Upper House Hotel. On arrival we were met at ground level by a very friendly and knowledgeable staff member who took us to our suite and then explained how many items were operated. This was in keeping with friendly but respectful tone of the service, which we preferred to the often austere and detached service found in some luxury hotels. The check-in takes place in the room. The room had north and easterly views. The previous reviewer has pointed out that there is a building site where HMS Tamar used to be located- however as it was 46 floors below it did not trouble us at all. The main thing you see from the room is Hong Kong harbour and its surrounds. The living room is spacious and comfortably furnished. Whilst every guest would furnish the ideal room differently, it is a very pleasant room to spend time in. The bed, whilst being softer than I am used to (ditto the pillows although I now understand you can request firm pillows)., the bed was still very comfortable. The bed sits in ther middle of the room, which at first seemed odd but grew on us as the days passed. There is a large spacious closet to hang two peoples clothes, as well as pleny of room to dress near the closet, rather than next to the bed. The bathroom is stunning, with the bath as its central feature, set in the middle. The bathroom has two external walls, so one can sit in the bath gazing at Hong Kong. Whilst it is certainly not the largest bathroom we have had in a hotel ( the one bedroom suites at the Wynn take that prize) I think it is the most stunning and atmospheric- at night the lighting is fantastic. The previous reviewer has criticised the lack of power plugs in the bedroom- they are there, just hard to find those near the bed. He has also criticised the lack of automated blinds- they are being retro fitted. He also said he found the suite noisy. We found it one of the quitest rooms we have stayed in. Maybe all the rooms beside us, above and below were vacant- I dont know. All I know is that the room was very quiet. We live in a quiet part of Sydney on a very large block of land, so any noise at night disturbs me. We did not have difficulties with reflections on the windows other than at night with the lights on. We also had no difficulty with water pressure. As to filling the bath, it will inevitably take some time to fill given its size- it is huge! It is true that the a key is not required for entry to the floor, but this is central Hong Kong, not Mexico. We lived in Hong Kong for 4 years- it is not a high crime city. I understand the manager of the Upper House spent most of his career with the Mandarin Hotel. This shows in the attention to detail and the attitude of the staff- everyone we dealt with was first class. Whether it was making a dinner reservation for us, attending to our car or escorting the pizza delivery man to our door, it was all efficient and friendly. For anyone planning to rent a car in Hong Kong, which we always do a for a few days, at the Upper House your car is parked at the front entrance so you can gain access easily to to retrieve those items you forgot to bring up to the room. The Upper House is a wonderful hotel for a couple to spend a relaxing week in Hong Kong. I am amazed that anyone could fail to enjoy this hotel. Any criticism I would have would be quibbles which are really just personal preferences. My only criticism is with the room service menu- it is very limited. I will be very surprised if that is not recified very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but doesn't meet my expectations”
Reviews.Author: BENLEE123
Reviews.Content: The Upper House Hong Kong, managed by Swire Hotel group is a design-driven luxury boutique hotel which only recently opened and thus still brand new. Tipped to be the new Landmark Mandarin with a view ( and larger rooms ), I was eager to see if it lives up to all the hype. Also, the special promo rate ( stay 1 night, get 1 night free ) the hotel was having also enticed me to try. Arrival I booked a limo ( Lexus ) to pick me up from airport. The hotel sent a Mercedes instead. I was told I have been “upgraded” as my chauffeur tried to convince me that the Mercedes is better than the Lexus. OK, I thought bec it does cost more for the Mercedes. In actual, it’s because the Lexus wasn’t available for some reason. Was slightly disappointed because I thought I can try out the new Lexus. Anyway, small matter. On arrival, a lady staff escorted me to the room. The check-in was done using some kind of wireless tablet device. It will be cool if it didn’t hang a few times on the spot. I was told all guests are given in-room check-in. In fact, the hotel doesn’t even have a dedicated reception area or concierge desk. A counter with some staff are positioned at the entrance which serve the role of reception, concierge and bell-hop. The Room I booked a one-bedroom suite called the Upper Suite. It’s an expansive 1230 sq foot suite with large wall-to-wall windows that have views of Victoria Harbour, the Peak and Hong Kong central city skyline. Unfortunately, it also has a direct view of a rather ugly construction site. I also have problems enjoying the view because of reflections. More on that later. The living room is very spacious with a large sitting area that can sit 5-6 people comfortably. The bedroom has a large comfortable bed with nice linens. The bathroom is the best of the bunch, with separate vanity and bath area. A large shower cubicle with the new skyshower overhead and a good size tub facing city view and overall have a very “zen” feel to it. There’s a TV in the bathroom that when switched off, it’s actually part of the mirror. Very Cool. The suite is decorated throughout in subdue beige tones ( as per the website photos ). There’s extensive use of blond beige wood partitions throughout the suite. It’s all very minimalist and streamline. The fittings and furniture are indeed good quality, but not exactly top of the line. Overall, I can’t help but feel that there is a lack of wow factor, it’s very understated, minimalist and residential than luxurious. There’s just too much wood around, all of the same or similar texture and color. Yes it’s a matter of taste but it feels bland and boring to me. The hotel provide a “Maxi Bar” with free sweets, chocolates, soft drink, mineral water and beers. There’s also a weird ( and in my opinion extremely ugly looking ) coffee machine that looks like Wall-E. Some cons about this suite room, nothing really serious but still some are compromises and some are just plain annoying. - For a boutique hotel that supposedly placed a heavy emphasis on service, I’m kind of surprise there’s no welcome amenity or even a welcome letter in the suite when I checked-in. - There’s no DVD player. You can request one to be installed in the room, but it’s “subjected to availability”. In this day and age, one would expect a DVD player to be a standard room amenity for any 4 or 5-star hotel. This is a careless omission on the part of the hotel which I feel inconvenience the hotel guests. - There’s no automated blinds for the windows, kind of strange for a hotel that prides itself on having the latest in-room technology. To make matters worst, there’s actually lots of windows in this suite and the bedroom does gets warm during the morning, so lots of opening and closing of curtains manually. - There’s a lack of plugs in the bedroom. Some are hidden in practically inaccessible areas like below the side table next to the bed. - As mentioned, there’s lots of window at all sides of the suite, most of which are diagonal to one another and consequently, there’s lots of reflection, which spoil the view. The view itself isn’t that great either, it’s not an unobstructed view and doesn’t face the best side of the harbor ( for my suite at least ). - The soundproofing is not good. I can hear people walking around in the room above me. It’s not distracting enough to disturb my sleep but still annoying nevertheless when I’m awake. The poor soundproofing may have something to do with the origin of the building housing the hotel, which was constructed initially as an apartment and subsequently refurbished to a hotel. To the hotel’s credit, they did try to resolve the problem by asking the hotel guest on the room above me who was checking out to quiet down. The noise subsided a while but afterwards, the cleaners were cleaning the room and the noise return… Oh mine. That’s where I decided one night is enough at this hotel. - As if the soundproofing issues wasn't enough, the extensive use of wood in the suite cause constant creaking sound on a regular intervals, even when I’m just switching on the lights or walking in the room or even when I’m not doing anything! Click Click Clark Clark …. - The water pressure could have been better. It take ages for the bathtub to fill up ( 20+ mins ) and the rainforest shower which is great end up feeling unsatisfying because of the low water pressure. Let’s just say I prefer rainforest showers that “rains heavily”. - The toiletries provided are a relatively unknown “REN” brand but I don’t find them very good. It hardly foams. - Room service menu have only a handful of choices. I guess nobody will bother to order room service most of the time. - The guest floors doesn’t require a cardkey to access, a considerable security risk I think since the hotel is accessible through the entrance and on the side balcony. - Notice that the soft drinks in the Maxi bar wasn’t replenished during turn-down. Not sure if it’s policy not to replenish or simply the housekeeping has forgotten. Common Areas Before I checked in, I already knew this hotel is a boutique hotel ( only 100+ rooms ). I was thinking it’s like the Landmark Mandarin. However, the Upper House is even more boutique than this. There’s no Spa for example. There is no swimming pool. There is a small gym which is self-service and accessible by using the room cardkeys. It’s empty when I was there and I don’t see any staff attending and it makes me feel uneasy using it alone. There’s no designated reception and concierge area but there's staff at the ground level and lobby to attend to guests request. The only place that one can sit or meet visitors is a small sitting lounge area at the 49th floor that served also as the hotel’s “lobby”. There is only one café that serve ala carte breakfast / lunch and dinner. I took a quick glance at the menu and as expected, it’s astronomically priced. To be fair, I can’t hold this against the hotel. Perhaps the food quality is very good which can justify the price. Anyway, I didn’t try. Instead, I choose to have buffet breakfast at the neighbouring Island Shangri-la and was glad with my choice because the food there was excellent and the staff service outstanding. Service Hotel staff are all polite and friendly as expected since it’s a boutique hotel but none really go out of the way to do anything extra. It’s basically just standard 5-star service in Hong Kong, ie fast, polite and efficient. However, to be fair, there isn’t much opportunity for them to really demonstrate their service capability to me since I end up staying only for one night ( although I booked two ). One point to note is that the staff English language ability are very good, including even the housekeeping staff. Notice also some staff share the elevator with me on several occasions but didn’t bother to greet. Probably they are not sure if I’m hotel guests or patrons of the café since we all used the same lift. Conclusion Under promotion, it’s good value at HK$6688++ under the stay one night get one night free promotion which works out to only HK$3344++ a night. For this price, you got a huge suite at one of the highest hotel in Hong Kong. This promo rate should be particularly attractive for travelling couples with small children. If it is not under promotion, I’m not so sure. Size and spaciousness is one thing, but somehow, the room just feels too “residential” for me instead of luxurious. I felt like I was staying at a really nice service apartment instead of a luxury hotel. Sure, maybe that’s what the Upper House aspire to be, a “home away from home” for it’s guests. However, not all hotel guests, like myself for example, like to stay at a hotel that reminds them of their own home / apartment with it’s residential style rooms and décor. Overall the Upper House is a disappointment for me because my expectation was quite high and it haven’t been met. It’s certainly nice and comfortable but luxurious? Sorry, not in my books. There isn’t anything serious to find fault with, but there is enough small faults and inadequacies here and there as I mentioned above which distract from a satisfying stay. I also wish the hotel has positioned itself as a high-end service apartment or a specialty design hotel instead of a luxury boutique hotel. For those desiring a really luxurious boutique hotel experience and don’t mind not having a view, the Landmark Mandarin remains the superior choice in my humble opinion. I’ll rate the Upper House a mere passable 3/5. If they can correct those faults like sound-proofing issues and others, it’s deserving a 4/5. Will I return? Highly unlikely. In fact, I intended earlier to stay 2 nights, but check-out after one night and went back to my old favorite, the Four Seasons. The Upperhouse is a nice hotel but it just isn’t my cup of tea. So if you want to choose to stay at this hotel, make sure you can appreciate it’s minimalist design/décor and accept some of their limitations.

Reviews.Title: “Better then a 5 star with views to die for”
Reviews.Author: starfe
Reviews.Content: It has everything. Location, great staff & the most comfortable beds. The french toast at breakfast was out of this world.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty darm good all round”
Reviews.Author: asia6666
Reviews.Content: Massive suite, 1,200 feet, gorgeous bathtub and lots of neat freebies (playing cards, minbar, carry bag , etc etc. Restaurant is overpriced for breakfast, but looks and feels good otherwise. Gym is small but very high tech. You can't beat the location in Pacific Place. Only surprising thing is , it lakcs the complete funkiness of Opposite ouse BJ - becuase they used an existing apartment on renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary. Cool. Undesrtated. Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: thomas_destinations
Reviews.Content: One of the most comfortable rooms i have experienced in the last few years. Attention to detail. All the cosy comforts. And REN bathroom amenities. WOW. Then there is the view from the shower and bath tub. AMAZING -- with great sculpture and art!

Reviews.Title: “The new state of the art in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Dopanijoso
Reviews.Content: The rooms are unbelievably huge, starting at over 700 square feet, gorgeously decorated in a modern style by a hot HK designer and abslutely pristine, given that the hotel has only been open for 3 weeks. Spectacular bathrooms, great views of the city, free access to the mini bar and state of the art electronics come standard. Service was excellent, they are clearly trying very hard to please their guests. The only slight quibble I have is the very limited room service menu and only one in house restaurant , also with a pretty limited menu. I have previously stayed at the 4 Seasons, Mandarin Oriental, Inter-Continental and Langham Place hotels in Hong Kong and the Upper House is in a different league to any of those fine hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent designer hotel with stunning harbour views”
Reviews.Author: pigmicwong
Reviews.Content: The Upper house is not a hotel, it is a home away from home. Designed by world famous Andre Fu to be a place of residential calmness the Upper house has certainly done it's job. The Upper house is described as an upward journey beggining at the ground floor where guests descend on escalators and up a lift to the 49th floor where the restaurant and lounge is. With few facilities and just one world class restaurant and bar, the Upper house is a discreet hideaway for movie stars and famous chefs alike visiting Hong Kong wanting to get away from the crowd. Also the hotel which starts at the 38th floor gives guests a great view of either the harbour or the lush greenery on the mountains to the rear. Pros: The rooms and suites in the hotel (there are 117 in all) have been created with care and affection and each peice has been selected carefully. The massive bathrooms which are at least 300 square feet have either stunning views of the harbour or of the lush mountainside greenery. All in all the rooms and especially the suites are true masterpeices and starting at 700 square feet they are the largest hotel rooms in Hong Kong. Down, or in our case, up on the 49th floor there is the world class Cafe Gray Deluxe. You guessed right, world famous chef Gray Kunz is the main chef here at Cafe Gray which sports international cuisine with Asian fusions. But like the entire hotel the cafe Gray is intimate and discreet and rather than a huge buffet every morning there is a delicious menu bursting with delights from the mouth watering Danish pastries to the well presented eggs Florentine. The menu will leave you full and happy afterwards even if there isn't a buffet like you would expect. The restaurant also sports one of Hong Kong's longest bars and at 14 metres it very well could be. Every evening the bar is crowded with people enjoying liqouir from all over. Downstairs on the 7th floor just above the small entrance there is a nice lawn area with a comfortable patio on which are soft armchairs where functions can be held and guests can sip cocktails on bean bags in the evenings. Back at the rooms guests can reside after a long night out in super soft king sized beds with Egypten cotton quilts and soft duck feather pillows. But before sleeping there is a choice of either a deep soaking tub with a flat screen TV to watch or a rain forest shower both boasting stunning views out of the floor to ceiling windows. Then you can put on your super soft bathroab which I highly reccomend you try and watch movies (there are DVD players in all rooms) on the 40 inch flat screen TV's in every room. Cons: Like I mentioned earlier the hotel has few facilities but perhaps for some that is a bit too few. For a start there is no pool so guests have to walk to the JW Marriott in the same building accessed by the 7th floor and even though the pool is rather unattractive at the moment there are plans to renovate it. But if you are thinking, Ok I will try out the Spa then unfortunately there isn't one either. But for those who love fitness there is an excellent gym with stunning views which you will have to bring your kit for but it is well worth it. All in all though this hotel is one of a rare bread, a discreet and intimate designer hotel high above the noisy roads with the feeling of a true home away from home. I definately reccommend this for leisure travellors or perhaps people on buissness trips.

Reviews.Title: “A cut above the rest”
Reviews.Author: Iheartholidays38
Reviews.Content: Exceptional staff. Spacious rooms, great design, very comfortable beds. Fantastic views of Hong Kong. Perfect location. Upscale restaurant with mouth watering food! Will definitely be back!
